title: Andhra Pradesh, Telangana Weather LATEST update: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm forecast for THESE places - MSN
article_text:
Planning something for the weekend? Do it now! You might not be able to later. Find out why
Heavy rains are lashing Telugu states due to the southwest monsoon and a surface circulation in the Bay of Bengal. The IMD predicts this will continue for another four to five days. Let's find out which districts in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana are likely to experience rainfall.
The Hyderabad Meteorological Center has warned of heavy rainfall, and very heavy rainfall in some places in several districts of Telangana today (June 14, Saturday). Specifically, southern Telangana districts like Narayanapet, Mahabubnagar, Gadwal, Vikarabad, Sangareddy, Wanaparthy, Rangareddy... and northern Telangana districts like Adilabad, Asifabad, Nirmal are likely to experience heavy rainfall in the evening or night. The Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for these districts.
The Meteorological Department has also indicated the possibility of moderate rainfall in Bhupalpally, Mulugu, Bhadradri, Kothagudem, Mahabubabad, Warangal, and Hanamkonda districts. Light showers are expected in other districts, and even if it doesn't rain, the weather will remain cool.
The Meteorological Department has announced the possibility of light showers in Hyderabad. The city is expected to be humid in the afternoon, and the sky will be cloudy by evening, bringing cooler temperatures. There might be light showers, but no heavy rainfall is expected. Hyderabadis can enjoy this weekend with cool and pleasant weather.
Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window.
Bengaluru: The Namma Metro Yellow Line is expected to begin operations by June 2025. The metro route, starting from Rashtreeya Vidyalaya (R.V.) Road to Bommasandra, aims to provide much-needed relief to commuters struggling with Bengaluru’s heavy traffic.
Full-scale services have yet to commence, authorities plan to initially open seven stations, including both terminal points. In the early phase, only three train sets will be in operation, running at 30-minute intervals due to a limited number of driverless trains. The third train set arrived at the Hebbagodi depot on May 13, with trial runs scheduled to begin soon, according to a report by Times Property.
ALSO READ: Bengaluru Namma Metro Commuters Slam BMRCL After Trains Seen Wrapped With Ads
Officials from Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) have confirmed that full operations across all 16 stations are expected by August or September 2025, pending the arrival of additional train sets and required safety approvals.
The Yellow Line is a vital component of Phase 2 of the Namma Metro project. Spanning approximately 18.82 kilometres, it connects R.V. Road in the south to Bommasandra in the east. This corridor links key residential neighborhoods, tech hubs, and industrial zones, making it a significant advancement for Bengaluru’s public transportation network.
With traffic congestion a daily challenge for Bengaluru residents, the Yellow Line is expected to reduce commute times, decrease reliance on private vehicles, and support the city’s transition toward sustainable, eco-friendly mobility.
The Yellow Line features a fully elevated track with 16 stations designed to serve high-traffic areas and enhance accessibility across Bengaluru. Key stations include:
R.V. Road – Connects with the Green Line
Jayadeva Hospital – Provides vital access to the hospital
B.T.M. Layout – Serves a densely populated neighborhood
Silk Board – Alleviates congestion at a notorious traffic hotspot
H.S.R. Layout – Supports a major IT and residential area
Oxford College – Convenient for students and staff
Electronic City Phase 1 – Crucial for tech professionals
Bommasandra – Terminal station serving industrial and residential commuters
Other stations, Muneshwara Nagar, Central Silk Board, Bommanahalli, Hongasandra, Kudlu Gate, Singasandra, Basapura, and Hosa Road, have been strategically chosen to serve busy and growing localities.
Once operational, the Yellow Line will run daily from 5:00 AM to 11:00 PM. During peak hours, trains will arrive every 10 minutes, while off-peak intervals will extend to 15 minutes. These timings are designed to provide flexible travel options for early morning workers, students, and late-night commuters alike.
ALSO READ: Bengaluru Namma Metro Update: Commute Service Sees Record Footfall Of 10 Lakh In A Day Amid RCB Celebrations
Fares on the Yellow Line will range from Rs 15 to Rs 85, based on the distance traveled. Commuters will have the option to use smart cards, QR code-based tickets, or traditional paper tickets. Additionally, digital payment methods will be available to provide a seamless and cashless travel experience.

title: Heavy rain forecast for Maharashtra today, red alert issued in Raigad - lokmattimes.com
article_text:
Heavy rain forecast for Maharashtra today, red alert issued in Raigad

By IANS | Updated: June 16, 2025 10:03 IST

Mumbai, June 16 As the monsoon has become active, the Meteorological Department said the intensity of rains will ...
Heavy rain forecast for Maharashtra today, red alert issued in Raigad

Mumbai, June 16 As the monsoon has become active, the Meteorological Department said the intensity of rains will increase throughout the day on Monday and issued alerts for various regions of Maharashtra.

It has issued a red alert in Raigad district, orange alert in Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg, Pune ghat section, Satara ghat section, Kolhapur ghat section and yellow alert in Mumbai, Palghar, Thane, Nashik ghat section, Nagpur, Bhandara, Gondia, Gadchiroli.

The weather bureau has predicted thunderstorms with lightning likely in Buldhana, Akola, Amravati, Washim, Yavatmal, Wardha, Nagpur, Bhandara, Gondia, Chandrapur and Gadchiroli districts.

The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in its post on X said, “The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a warning of heavy rains in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (Mumbai city and suburbs) for next three hours. For help in an emergency or for official, contact the BMC’s main control room helpline number 1916.”

Due to the rain, the Central, Western and Harbour Railways in Mumbai are running late by 5 to 10 minutes. Heavy rainfall has been continuing in the Vasai-Virar area since Sunday evening, and many low-lying areas of the city have been submerged. As a result, traffic and normal life have been disrupted.

The state government sources said the respective Divisional Commissioners and District Collectors have been asked to keep vigil and be prepared to conduct relief rescue works. The state emergency operations centre situated at Mantralaya has been in touch with all districts to streamline relief and rescue works.

“There is a cyclonic circulation over South Central Maharashtra and its vicinity at a height of 7.6 km above sea level. Cyclonic circulation is also prevailing over the Bay of Bengal at a height of 3.1 to 7.6 km above sea level. Due to this, the monsoon has now become active. The Meteorological Department has predicted that the monsoon will advance over Vidarbha, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh and Odisha as the weather is conducive for the advance of the monsoon,” said state government sources.

Mumbai and Pune cities have been receiving continuous rain since the night. Heavy rain has been recorded in the Pune area since night, 113 mm of rain has been recorded in the Varandha Ghat Shirgaon area, while there has been a drizzle in the Mutha Ghat leading to Lavasa.

The weather bureau has predicted that the intensity of rain will decrease in Mumbai and Thane on Tuesday and Wednesday, and there will be moderate rain.

Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

The weather department also said there were chances of light rain and isolated thunderstorms between Thursday and Saturday, but did not issue a colour-coded alert.
Meanwhile, parts of Mumbai and Kerala received heavy rainfall as the IMD issued alerts and predicted more showers at isolated places in the city and suburbs, civic officials said.

By Lokmat English Desk | Updated: June 16, 2025 07:26 IST

At least four, including a 3-year-old child, have been killed, and several others were trapped inside the debris after ...
West Virginia Flash Flood: 4, Including 3-Year-Old, Killed; Several Trapped as Building Partially Collapses in Fairmont (Watch)

At least four, including a 3-year-old child, have been killed, and several others were trapped inside the debris after flash floods impacted several areas, leading to partial building collapse in Fairmont City in West Virginia on Sunday, June 15. Governor Patrick Morrisey, in a Facebook post, said at least four people died due to flooding.

"There were roughly 3 to 4 inches of water that fell in the area in less than an hour. That's very, very difficult to deal with," Morrisey declared a state of emergency, and he asked the first responders attempting to reach people in the flooding. He said four people were missing in flash floods

title: LIVE Weather News 16 June 2025: मुंबई में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट, जानें IMD का लेटेस्ट अपडेट - News24 Hindi
article_text:
LIVE Aaj Ka Mausam 16 June 2025: दिल्ली-एनसीआर के कुछ हिस्सों में आज फिर से हल्की बारिश शुरू हो सकती है। रविवार को दिल्ली में कुछ जगहों पर बारिश हुई थी। वहीं यूपी-बिहार में भी बारिश का अलर्ट दिया गया है। कई जगहों पर यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। फिलहाल, हीट वेव का असर कम है और कुछ इलाकों में मौसम में बदलाव देखने को मिल रहा है। कब-कब आंधी और बारिश आ सकती है और पहाड़ों में बारिश जारी है। इसके अलावा अन्य राज्यों को लेकर कैसा रहेगा मौसम का मिजाज। आइए जान लेते हैं देशभर का मौसम सिर्फ News24 के साथ…
आज सभी जिलों में छाए रहेंगे बादल, 11 जिलों में भारी बारिश की संभावना, मौसम विभाग ने जारी किया ऑरेंज अलर्ट।
महाराष्ट्र की नवी मुंबई में आज सुबह बारिश हुई।
watch | Maharashtra: Navi Mumbai receives rainfall this morning. pic.twitter.com/ERgkyJ9NTA
सुबह-सुबह हुई मुंबई में बारिश, आईएमडी ने आज शहर में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है।
watch | Morning rain showers drench Mumbai; IMD has sounded an alert for heavy rain in the city today
Visuals from BPT, Wadala East pic.twitter.com/1tNkSRiADI
भोपाल- मानसून से पहले प्रदेश में आंधी-बारिश का दौर। तापमान में गिरावट, भारी उमस से परेशान हैं। कल भी आंधी-बारिश का अलर्ट है।
भोपाल, इंदौर, उज्जैन, निवाड़ी, टीकमगढ़, छतरपुर, रीवा, सीधी, सिंगरौली, पन्ना, दमोह, मंडला, बालाघाट, सिवनी, पांढुर्ना, छिंदवाड़ा, नरसिंहपुर, सागर, विदिशा, रायसेन, नर्मदापुरम, बेतूल, हरदा, सीहोर, देवास, शाजापुर, खंडवा, बुरहानपुर, खरगोन, बड़वानी, अलीराजपुर, झाबुआ, रतलाम, मंदसौर, शिवपुरी, अशोक नगर, गुना, राजगढ़, आगर मालवा, सतना, मैहर, मऊगंज, कटनी, जबलपुर, उमरिया, शहडोल, अनूपपुर, डिंडोरी समेत नीमच में बारिश की संभावना है।
मुंबई में तेज आंधी-तूफान आने वाला है। अगले 6-12 घंटों में कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है।
Intense thunderstorms approaching Mumbai. Few heavy rain spells likely in next 6-12 hours..mumbai mumbairains pic.twitter.com/OvwF3RG4ee
— 🔴All India Weather (@pkusrain) June 15, 2025
पश्चिमी उत्तर प्रदेश में भारी तूफान देखा गया।
Significant thunderstorms observed over West UP. pic.twitter.com/vy4lTvEnRf
— 🔴All India Weather (@pkusrain) June 16, 2025
कुछ दिनों से दिल्ली-एनसीआर में गर्मी हो रही थी, लेकिन 2 दिनों से मौसम में बदलाव देखने को मिल रहा है। आज भी कुछ इलाकों में हल्की बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है।
Great thunderstorms and rainfall observed few km southwest of Delhi NCR. pic.twitter.com/YVtdx85Aye
— 🔴All India Weather (@pkusrain) June 15, 2025
जम्मू शहर के कई हिस्सों में कल बारिश हुई। आज कैसा रहेगा मौसम, जानें।
watch | Rain lashes several parts of Jammu City pic.twitter.com/ujxgPXf9lV
जम्मू और कश्मीर में सुबह उधमपुर के कुछ हिस्सों में बारिश हुई।
watch | Jammu and Kashmir: Rain lashed parts of Udhampur earlier today. pic.twitter.com/7pBkEnLocQ
केरल में भारी बारिश के बाद कोझिकोड के कई हिस्सों में जलभराव हो गया है।
watch | Kerala: Waterlogging in several parts of Kozhikode following heavy rainfall pic.twitter.com/F19lZPFKVx
उत्तर प्रदेश: अयोध्या में मौसम सुहाना हो गया है, शहर में हल्की बारिश और तेज हवाएं चल रही हैं, जिससे गर्मी से राहत मिली है।
watch | UP: Weather turns pleasant in Ayodhya as the city receives light showers and strong breeze, bring respite from heat. pic.twitter.com/hgDbRnMPyk
— IMD Ahmedbad (@IMDAHMEDABAD) June 15, 2025
— IMD Ahmedbad (@IMDAHMEDABAD) June 15, 2025
16 जून 2025 के लिए मौसम की चेतावनी कहां-कहां दी गई है? जानिए imd का अपडेट

title: UP Monsoon: Rain warning along with thunderstorm in 54 districts of Uttar Pradesh - Times Bull
article_text:
UP Monsoon Alert: The weather is quite bad in many areas of Uttar Pradesh. Although it may take several days for the monsoon to arrive in UP, pre-monsoon rains are already underway. It has been raining since morning, providing people with relief from the heat due to the drop in temperature.

Not only this, in the last day, 22 people in the state have lost their lives due to the storm and lightning. The following 24 hours are not going to be easy for UP, as the weather is expected to be quite bad. According to the Indian Meteorological Department, an alert has been issued for heavy rain with thunder and lightning in 51 districts of the state. You can find the weather details below in more detail.

Rain warning in these districts

According to the Indian Meteorological Department, a warning of rain with thunder and lightning has been issued in 51 districts of UP on June 16. IMD has issued a yellow alert for rain with thunder and thunderstorms in Gautam Budh Nagar, Ghaziabad, Meerut, Hapur, and Baghpat. Apart from these, the weather is expected to deteriorate in Shamli, Muzaffarnagar, Aligarh, Agra,  and Mathura.

Etah, Kasganj, Hathras, Firozabad, and Mainpuri may also receive rain accompanied by thunder. Etawah, Auraiya, Bijnor, Amroha and Moradabad may also receive rain. A rain alert has also been issued for Rampur, Bareilly, Pilibhit, Sambhal, Badaun, Jalaun, Hamirpur, Mahoba, Jhansi and Lalitpur.

Banda, Chitrakoot, Kaushambi, Prayagraj, Pratapgarh, Sonbhadra, Mirzapur, Sant Ravidas Nagar, and Hardoi may receive rain accompanied by thunderstorms. A rain alert has been issued in many districts, including Farrukhabad, Kannauj, Fatehpur, Kanpur Dehat, Kanpur Nagar, Unnao, Lucknow, Barabanki, Raebareli, and Amethi.

Many people lost their lives due to lightning.

Storms, rain, and lightning became the cause of death in many parts of Uttar Pradesh. Twenty-two people died in the state. Four members of the same family died due to lightning. In Moradabad and Sambhal, separate accidents occurred due to lightning, resulting in the deaths of three people.

Among these, two women from Sambhal and one from Moradabad lost their lives. Rampbyrm eyed lawyers. Eight people in Rampurt, including four children, lost their lives due to lightning in Ghazipur, Jaunpur, and Sonbhadra yesterday. Meaning, in the last 18 hours, the weather gave painful wounds to the people of UP.

title: UP Monsoon Update - Heavy to Light Rain Alert for Next 2 Days in 51 districts, Check Full Forecast - Times Bull
article_text:
UP Monsoon Update: Sunday has been a little respite for the people of Uttar Pradesh. Over the last few days, most districts in UP have been experiencing severe heat. Due to strong sunlight and heat, it had become difficult for people to live. At the same time, light rain on Sunday has given people some relief from the heat.

Yesterday, light rain was observed in many districts of UP, resulting in a drop in temperature. Meanwhile, people are eagerly waiting for the monsoon. According to the Meteorological Department, there is a possibility of light rain accompanied by strong winds throughout the state from Monday. It is being described as the arrival of the monsoon.

According to the Meteorological Department, monsoon may enter the state on June 18 through Gorakhpur. IMD has shared important information about the weather in UP. The Meteorological Department has given considerable indications about pre-monsoon rain in UP. The Meteorological Department estimates that from today to the next few days, there may be heavy and light rain in many districts of UP.

Rain warning in UP!
The Meteorological Department predicts heavy to light rain in UP from June 16 to June 18. On June 16, a yellow alert was issued for rain in 51 districts of Uttar Pradesh (UP). A yellow alert has been issued in districts from western Uttar Pradesh to eastern Uttar Pradesh.

According to the Meteorological Department, today there is a possibility of rain in many districts of UP, including Kanpur, Kanpur Dehat, Lucknow, Prayagraj, Noida, Barabanki, Rae Bareli, Unnao, Hardoi, Kannauj, Farrukhabad, Sant Ravidas Nagar, Banda, Chitrakoot, Fatehpur, Sonbhadra, Mirzapur, Kaushambi, Meerut, Saharanpur, Baghpat, Shamli, Muzaffarnagar, Hapur, Amethi, Mahoba, Amroha, Moradabad, Bareilly, Pilibhit, Sambhal, Rampur, Bijnor, Agra, Auraiya, Bulandshahr, Mathura.

title: Red alert in Maharashtra Goa Karnataka for heavy rainfall - urbanacres.in
article_text:
HomeLatestRed alert in Maharashtra Goa Karnataka for heavy rainfall
Red alert in Maharashtra Goa Karnataka for heavy rainfall
By
UrbanNews
June 16, 2025
0
 Share
Red alert in Maharashtra Goa Karnataka for heavy rainfall
TAGSClimate Resilient Citiescoastal rain warningIMD Red AlertMaharashtra Goa Karnataka heavy rainmonsoon Maharashtra Goasustainable city planningthunderstorm safety
India’s west coast remains under intense weather threat as the India Meteorological Department has extended a red alert over coastal Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka on 16 June, with additional orange warnings across 13 other states. Meteorologists attribute this to a weakening tropical low, bringing extremely heavy rain, thunderstorms and strong winds across the region over the next two days.
The red alert was maintained after relief in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, signalling persistent weather volatility. Coastal Karnataka and Goa continue to face a risk of over 200 mm of rain in 24 hours, triggering fears of flash flooding and damage to infrastructure. Meanwhile, orange alerts in Telangana, Gujarat, Bihar, Assam and others highlight the uniform reach of this active monsoon backbone . The IMD specified that coastal Karnataka and Goa would bear the brunt of extremely heavy rainfall (>20 cm) on 16 June. These areas remain at high risk of landslides, ponded water, and interruptions to power and transport.
In Maharashtra, coastal districts including Raigad and Ratnagiri remain on red alert, while the wider Konkan belt, including Mumbai, stands under orange warning for the same period. Monsoon progression is underway in Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha and West Bengal, with precursor activity in North India—particularly Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh—expected between 18–21 June . n the ground, urban areas are bracing for impact. Coastal cities and hill corridors are preparing emergency services for potential disruptions. Fishermen along the Konkan and Goa coasts have been advised not to venture out through 19 June, as squally winds reach 55 km/h with gusts to 65 km/h . Transport departments in Pune and Mumbai have begun pre-monsoon interventions, clearing storm drains, reinforcing river embankments and monitoring vulnerable zones.
The warnings come amid a cycle of extreme weather: Konkan and Goa have already endured 100–250 mm of rainfall, straining infrastructure and prompting repeated flash-flood responses. Mumbai grappled with simultaneous orange and yellow alerts across adjoining districts, witnessing travel delays and power outages due to wind and rain . With heavy precipitation expected to continue, officials in the affected states have accelerated deployment of disaster squads, bolstered early-warning systems and opened river embankment monitoring cells. Drains and stormwater channels are being inspected ahead of predicted downpours, while rural engineering teams are clearing gullies and reinforcing embankments.
Urban resilience advocates welcome these measures—but caution that sustainable, long-term solutions are essential. They urge cities to invest in permeable pavements, water-retention wetlands and green buffers in flood zones to minimise flooding and reduce carbon-intensive draining systems. Emergency planners also highlight the importance of equitable preparedness. “We must ensure low-income communities are not left vulnerable,” said a senior disaster-management official. “Early-release of community shelters, electric feeder lines, and mobile communication are key to a climate-sensitive response.”
In Kerala and Tamil Nadu, lower alert levels have not ended the risk. Coastal Andhra, MP, and parts of Rajasthan remain under tactical orange zones for heavy rainfall and thunderstorms. Northeastern states have also been advised to maintain vigilance, with high winds and lightning predicted in Arunachal and Meghalaya through to June 21 . Weather experts warn that this monsoon phase is part of a broader climate trend: more volatile rainfall patterns and intense, short bursts of precipitation that overwhelm soil and urban systems. Each state is being prompted to review floodplain zoning, repair drainage, and adopt climate-adaptive building norms.
Municipal authorities are issuing advisories encouraging residents to secure loose infrastructure—roofs, antennas and temporary structures—and to shelter livestock and outdoor assets. A regional health advisory has also been raised, highlighting waterborne disease risks as monsoon waters accumulate in residential zones. For travellers and daily commuters, the advice is to monitor weather bulletins, avoid coastal and ghat roads during peak rain, and maintain flexible scheduling. Port authorities have restricted fishing and ferry navigation due to projected sea roughness.
In summary, the IMD’s extension of red alerts signifies that this phase of the southwest monsoon is not easing—and could worsen in intensity. While the immediate priority is emergency proofing, city leadership calls this a window to build future-ready, zero-carbon urban systems which resist monsoon extremes, safeguard communities and promote equitable resilience. Australia vulnerability has historically driven policy; whether Indian states now use this as a moment to re-engineer flood-proof and sustainable cities remains to be seen. The next two days present both a challenge and an opportunity to shift from reactive emergency efforts to structural green transitions.

title: Heavy Rain Alert: आज झूमकर बरसेंगे बादल, जानें यूपी के किन जिलों में होगी बारिश - Prabhat Khabar
article_text:
Advertisement
HomeRajyaउत्तर प्रदेश
Heavy Rain Alert: आज झूमकर बरसेंगे बादल, जानें यूपी के किन जिलों में होगी बारिश

Heavy Rain Alert: उत्तर प्रदेश में प्री-मानसून बारिश से गर्मी से राहत तो मिली, लेकिन मौसम ने कहर भी ढाया. आंधी, तेज बारिश और बिजली गिरने से राज्यभर में अब तक 22 लोगों की मौत हो चुकी है.

By
Ayush Raj Dwivedi
| June 16, 2025 9:24 AM
Heavy Rain Alert

Heavy Rain Alert: उत्तर प्रदेश में मौसम ने अचानक करवट ले ली है. रविवार को राज्य के कई जिलों में तेज बारिश और आंधी-तूफान ने जहां लोगों को गर्मी से राहत दी. वहीं कई इलाकों में यह मौसम कहर बनकर टूटा. बिजली गिरने और तेज हवाओं के कारण अलग-अलग हादसों में अब तक 22 लोगों की जान जा चुकी है.

प्रभात खबर डिजिटल प्रीमियम स्टोरी
50 Years of Emergency : क्या था तुर्कमान गेट कांड, जिसे बताया गया इमरजेंसी का काला अध्याय
Helicopter Crashes: उत्तराखंड में उड़न ताबूत बने हेलीकॉप्टर, डीजीसीए हुआ सख्त, जानें क्या प्रतिबंध लगाए
1986 की बात है, एक एयर होस्टेस थीं नीरजा भनोट; जो 360 लोगों की जान बचाते हुए कुर्बान हुईं
यूपी में जल्द आएगा मॉनसून

मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, यूपी में प्री-मानसून बारिश की शुरुआत हो चुकी है. इससे हीटवेव का सिलसिला अब थमने की संभावना है. रविवार को तापमान में गिरावट दर्ज की गई और लोगों ने गर्मी से काफी राहत महसूस की.

हालांकि राहत के साथ-साथ खतरे की घंटी भी बजी है. मौसम विभाग ने आज सोमवार को प्रदेश के 51 जिलों में आंधी-तूफान, तेज हवाएं और बिजली गिरने को लेकर चेतावनी जारी की है. अनुमान है कि तेज हवाओं की रफ्तार 40 से 50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटा तक पहुंच सकती है. इसके अलावा कुछ इलाकों में ओलावृष्टि की भी संभावना जताई गई है.

बारिश का यह दौर अगले तीन दिनों तक जारी रह सकता है. इस दौरान पूर्वी और पश्चिमी यूपी दोनों हिस्सों में गरज-चमक के साथ बारिश हो सकती है. मौसम वैज्ञानिकों का कहना है कि राज्य में 17 से 20 जून के बीच मानसून की आधिकारिक एंट्री हो सकती है.

इन जिलों में हो सकती है बारिश

प्रभावित जिलों की बात करें तो मेरठ, गाजियाबाद, प्रयागराज, लखनऊ, आगरा, झांसी, मथुरा, कानपुर, बरेली, और मिर्जापुर समेत 50 से ज्यादा जिलों में अलर्ट जारी किया गया है. वहीं, मुजफ्फरनगर, बिजनौर और सहारनपुर जैसे जिलों में ओले गिरने की भी चेतावनी है.

यह भी पढ़ें.. Census: अमित शाह ने की जनगणना की तैयारियों की समीक्षा, 16 जून को जारी होगी अधिसूचना

यह भी पढ़ें.. अगले 72 घंटे में भारी से बहुत भारी बारिश, 16 से 19 जून तक बिगड़ेगा मौसम, IMD का अलर्ट

article_text:
होम
मध्य प्रदेश
भोपाल
MP Weather Forecast Today: मानसून से पहले ही एमपी के कुछ जिलों में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, जानिए आज कैसा रहेगा मौसम
Madhya Pradesh: मध्य प्रदेश में मानसून का इंतजार जल्द ही खत्म होने वाला है। अगले दो से तीन दिन में मानसून प्रदेश के कुछ इलाकों में दस्तक दे देगा। मौसम विभाग ने कई जिलों में तेज बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है। इंदौर में भी मौसम में बदलाव देखा जाएगा। ग्वालियर अंचल में प्री-मानसून की दस्तक हो चुकी है और अब बारिश जारी रहने की संभावना है।
By Prashant Pandey
Edited By: Prashant Pandey
Publish Date: Mon, 16 Jun 2025 09:45:19 AM (IST)
Updated Date: Mon, 16 Jun 2025 10:01:23 AM (IST)
Join करें
ग्वालियर शहर में सुबह छाए बादल और रात में हुई बारिश।
HIGHLIGHTS
इंदौर में आज से मौसम में आएगा बदलाव।
ग्वालियर में शुरू हो गया है बारिश का दौर।
खंडवा, बड़वानी और आलीराजपुर में अलर्ट।

डिजिटल डेस्क, भोपाल Madhya Pradesh Temperature Today। मध्य प्रदेश के लोगों का मानसून का इंतजार अब जल्द ही खत्म होने वाला है। अगले दो से तीन दिन में ही मानसून प्रदेश के कुछ इलाकों में दस्तक दे देगा। मौसम विशेषज्ञों की माने तो प्रदेश में 18 जून से तेज बारिश का दौर शुरू हो सकता है।

इस बीच मौसम विभाग ने खंडवा, बड़वानी और आलीराजपुर जिले में तेज बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके साथ ही बैतूल, हरदा, बुरहानपुर, खरगौन, झाबुआ, धार, इंदौर, रतलाम, उज्जैन, देवास, शाजापुर, आगर, मंदसौर, नीमच, गुना, अशोकनगर, शिवपुरी, ग्वालियर, दतिया, भिंड, मुरैना, श्योपुरकलां जिलों 50 से 60 किमी प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से हवाओं के साथ ही बिजली गिरने की भी चेतावनी (Madhya Pradesh Weather Forecast Today) जारी की गई है।

इंदौर में आज जाएगा मौसम में बदलाव

इंदौर शहर में रविवार को पूर्वी-दक्षिण पूर्वी दिशा से हवा चली। इससे तापमान में गिरावट आई। फिर भी गर्मी महसूस हुई, उमस से लोग बेहाल होते रहे। बीते चौबीस घंटों में 3.4 डिग्री तापमान नीचे आया। अधिकतम तापमान 35.2 डिग्री सेल्सियस रहा, जबकि न्यूनतम तापमान 23.4 डिग्री सेल्सियस दर्ज किया गया। हवा की रफ्तार पंद्रह किमी प्रतिघंटा रही। विशेषज्ञ के मुताबिक सोमवार से मौसम में बदलाव देखा जाएगा।

ग्वालियर अंचल में रविवार रात प्री-मानसून की दस्तक, अब जारी रहेगी बारिश

ग्वालियर अंचल में मौसम (Madhya Pradesh Weather News) का मिजाज शनिवार से बदला हुआ है और लोगों के भीषण गर्मी से राहत मिली है। रविवार सुबह हुई बारिश के बाद अंचल के तापमान में 5.4 डिसे की गिरावट तो आई, लेकिन धूप की वजह से वातावरण में उमस बढ़ गई। उमस भी सामान्य से 16 प्रतिशत ज्यादा थी। रविवार को दिन का तापमान 37.1 डिसे रहा और रात का तापमान भी 25.6 डिसे पर रहा।

वहीं देर रात प्री-मानसून की वर्षा ने दस्तक दे दी। मौसम विभाग ने बारिश जारी रहने का अनुमान जताया है। बता दें कि अंचल में 5.4 मिमी बारिश हुई, मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र के मुताबिक अंचल में कहीं-कहीं पर गरज चमक के साथ बारिश हो सकती है। साथ ही सोमवार को तेज आंधी के साथ पानी आ सकता है। ऐसे में तापमान में गिरावट आने की संभावना है।

दो-तीन दिन में एमपी में दस्तक देगा मानसून

मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र के मुताबिक मानसून दो-तीन दिन में मध्यप्रदेश में दस्तक दे देगा। एक ऊपरी हवा का चक्रवातीय प्रसार मध्य महाराष्ट्र क्षेत्र में सक्रिय है। साथ ही इससे एक ट्रफ पूर्वी मध्य प्रदेश से छत्तीसगढ़, झारखंड और गंगीय पश्चिम बंगाल से होते हुए बांग्लादेश तक जा रही है। इसके साथ ही ऊपरी हवा का चक्रवातीय प्रसार उत्तरी राजस्थान और निकटवर्ती क्षेत्रों में सक्रिय है।

इससे एक ट्रफ उत्तरी राजस्थान और निकटवर्ती क्षेत्रों से पश्चिमी मध्यप्रदेश के ऊपर है। इन सभी सिस्टमों का असर अंचल में भी आ रहा है। जिसकी वजह से यहां तापमान भी कम हुआ और हल्की बारिश हुई। आगामी दो तीन दिन तक अंचल में इसी तरह का मौसम रहेगा। बीच-बीच में कहीं-कहीं पर हल्की बारिश भी हो सकती है।

article_text:

Madhya Pradesh Weather LATEST update: Heavy rain, thunderstorm alert for THESE places; Check
MP Weather Alert Today: Pre-monsoon havoc in Madhya Pradesh! 60+ districts on alert for strong winds, lightning, and heavy rain. Temperature drops up to 11 degrees in some areas. Is the 2025 monsoon unusual? Here's the 4-day forecast
Amrita Ghosh | Published : Jun 16 2025, 09:19 AM

MP Weather Alert: Statewide Storms and Winds

Weather

Pre-monsoon chaos in MP. Red alert for heavy rain in Narsinghpur and Dindori. Lightning strikes reported. Next 4 days look dangerous.

2
7
Image Credit : ISTOCK
Which districts will be most affected?
60+ districts warned of heavy rain and winds: Bhopal, Indore, Gwalior, Jabalpur to Singrauli, Rewa, Shahdol likely to see high winds (40-60 km/h) and rain. Narsinghpur, Seoni, and Dindori may experience very heavy rainfall.

Child Dies from Lightning Strike
Lightning strikes during MP rains: A 12-year-old returning from a field in Bhopal's Kekdia village was struck by lightning and died. This incident raises concerns across the state. Stay vigilant about lightning.
4
7
Image Credit : ISTOCK
MP Temperature Drops Suddenly
Narsinghpur's temperature dropped by 11.4 degrees. Khajuraho, Nowgong, Damoh, Sidhi, and Tikamgarh also saw 5-6 degree drops. This sudden weather change signals the approaching monsoon.
5
7
Image Credit : ISTOCK
When will the monsoon arrive in MP?
IMD announces monsoon arrival in the next 1-2 days. Three cyclonic circulations, a trough line, and a western disturbance are active, causing the stormy weather. The southwest monsoon may enter MP in the next 48 hours.
6

Image Credit : ISTOCK
4-Day District-Wise Alert Timetable
Full list from June 16-19: Where's the risk? - June 16: Narsinghpur, Dindori - Heavy Rain - June 17: Balaghat, Sagar - Heavy Rain - June 18: Seoni, Mandla - Alert - June 19: Rewa, Sidhi - Orange Alert 50+ districts on alert daily.

Staying Safe in Stormy Weather
Stay indoors during lightning, avoid mobile phones. Don't stand in fields, under trees, or in open areas. Follow weather updates and alerts. Precautions save lives.

title: தீவிரமடையும் தென்மேற்கு பருவமழை.. இன்று 6 மாவட்டங்களுக்கு கனமழை அலர்ட்! வெளுத்து வாங்க போகுது - Oneindia Tamil
article_text:
முகப்பு / வானிலை
தீவிரமடையும் தென்மேற்கு பருவமழை.. இன்று 6 மாவட்டங்களுக்கு கனமழை அலர்ட்! வெளுத்து வாங்க போகுது
By Mani Singh S
 Updated: Monday, June 16, 2025, 7:10 [IST]
  
Subscribe to Oneindia Tamil

சென்னை: தமிழகத்தில் இன்று ஒருசில இடங்களில் காலையிலேயே மழை கொட்டி வரும் நிலையில், நீலகிரிக்கு இன்று மிக கனமழை எச்சரிக்கை விடப்பட்டுள்ளது. சென்னையிலும் இன்று இடி மின்னலுடன் கூடிய மழைக்கு வாய்ப்பு இருப்பதாக கூறியுள்ள வானிலை மையம், கோயம்புத்தூர் மாவட்ட மலைப்பகுதிகள், திருப்பூர், திண்டுக்கல், தேனி மற்றும் தென்காசி உள்பட 6 மாவட்டங்களில் கனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்பு இருப்பதாக கூறியுள்ளது.

தென்மேற்கு பருவமழை மேற்கு தொடர்ச்சி மலை மாவட்டங்களில் மிக தீவிரமாக இருந்து வருகிறது. இதனால் தமிழகத்தில் நேற்று ஒருசில இடங்களில் மழை பெய்துள்ளது. காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளில் வேசான மழை பதிவாகியுள்ளது. புதுவையில் வறண்ட வானிலை நிலவியது. குறிப்பாக நீலகிரியின் அவலாஞ்சியில் நேற்று ஒரே நாளில் 14 செமீ அழை பதிவானது. கோவையின் சின்னக்கல்லாரில் 13 செமீ மழை பதிவாகியது.

Also Read
"கொங்கு+தென் மாவட்டங்கள் என எல்லா பக்கமும் சுத்தி அடிக்கும் மழை! அடுத்த 3 மணி நேரம் உஷார்"
நீலகிரிக்கு மிக கனமழை அலர்ட்

கோவை, நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்தின் பல்வேறு பகுதிகளில் கனமழை பெய்தது. இதேபோன்று தஞ்சை, குமரி, தென்காசி, நெல்லை, தர்மபுரி, நாகை மாவட்டங்களிலும் நேற்று பரவலாக மழை பெய்தது. இந்த நிலையில் தமிழகத்தில் இன்று நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்தில் கன முதல் மிக கனமழைக்கும், கோவை, தேனி, திருப்பூர் மாவட்டங்களில் கனமழைக்கும் வாய்ப்பு இருப்பதாக வானிலை மையம் கூறியுள்ளது. இது தொடர்பான வானிலை அறிவிப்பில் கூறப்பட்டிருப்பதாவது:-

இன்று எங்கெல்லாம் மழை பெய்யும்

மேற்கு திசை காற்றின் வேக மாறுபாடு காரணமாக இன்று திங்கட்கிழமை தமிழகத்தில் ஒரு சில இடங்களிலும், புதுவை மற்றும் காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளிலும், இடி, மின்னலுடன் கூடிய லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்யக்கூடும். ஓரிரு இடங்களில் பலத்த தரைக்காற்று மணிக்கு 40 முதல் 50 கிலோ மீட்டர் வேகத்தில் வீசக்கூடும்.

குறிப்பாக நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்தில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கன முதல் மிக கனமழையும், கோயம்புத்தூர் மாவட்ட மலைப்பகுதிகள், திருப்பூர், திண்டுக்கல், தேனி மற்றும் தென்காசி மாவட்டங்களில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கன மழையும் பெய்ய வாய்ப்பு உள்ளது.

Recommended For You
"அடுத்த 4 நாட்களுக்கு இந்த பகுதிகளில் எல்லாம் சம்பவம் இருக்கு! தமிழ்நாடு வெதர்மேன் கொடுத்த அலர்ட்"
கோவையில் கனமழைக்கு சான்ஸ்

வரும் 17 ஆம் தேதி தமிழகத்தில் ஓரிரு இடங்களிலும், புதுவை மற்றும் காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளிலும் லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்யக்கூடும். கோயம்புத்தூர் மாவட்டத்தின் மலைப்பகுதிகள் மற்றும் நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்தில் ஓரிரு இடங்களில் கனமழையும் பெய்யவாய்ப்புள்ளது.

18-06-2025 முதல் 21-06-2025 வரை தமிழகத்தில் ஓரிரு இடங்களிலும், புதுவை மற்றும் காரைக்கால் பகுதிகளிலும் லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்பு உள்ளது.

சென்னையில் இன்று இடி மின்னலுடன்

சென்னை மற்றும் புறநகர் பகுதிகளை பொறுத்தவரை இன்று திங்கட்கிழமை வானம் ஓரளவு மேகமூட்டத்துடன் காணப்படும். நகரின் ஒருசில பகுதிகளில் இடி, மின்னலுடன் கூடிய லேசானது முதல் மிதமான மழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்பு உள்ளது. அதிகபட்ச வெப்பநிலை 36 - 37° செல்சியஸை ஒட்டியும், குறைந்தபட்ச வெப்பநிலை 28 டிகிரி செல்சியஸை ஒட்டியும் இருக்கக் கூடும்.

மீனவர்களுக்கு எச்சரிக்கை

தென் தமிழக கடலோர பகுதிகள், மன்னார் வளைகுடா மற்றும் அதனை ஒட்டிய குமரி கடல் பகுதிகளில் 19 ஆம் தேதி வரை சூறாவளி காற்று மணிக்கு 45 முதல் 55 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 65 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், வடதமிழக கடலோர பகுதிகளில் சூறாவளி காற்று மணிக்கு 35 முதல் 45 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 55 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும் வீசக்கூடும்.

மத்திய மற்றும் தென்மேற்கு வங்கக்கடலின் அநேக பகுதிகளில் 19 ஆம் தேதி வரை சூறாவளிக்காற்று மணிக்கு 45 முதல் 55 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 65 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், ஆந்திர கடலோர பகுதிகள், தெற்கு வங்கக்கடல், மத்திய வங்கக் கடல் பகுதிகள், அந்தமான் கடல் பகுதிகளில் சூறாவளி காற்று மணிக்கு 35 முதல் 45 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 55 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும் வீசக்கூடும்.

அரபிக்கடல்

மத்திய மேற்கு அரபிக்கடலின் அநேக பகுதிகள் மற்றும் அதனை ஒட்டிய மத்திய கிழக்கு மற்றும் தென்மேற்கு அரபிக்கடலின் சில பகுதிகளில் 19 ஆம் தேதி வரை சூறாவளி காற்று மணிக்கு 45 முதல் 55 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 65 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், தென்கிழக்கு மத்திய கிழக்கு அரபிக்கடல் பகுதிகள், கொங்கன்- கோவா- கர்நாடகா- கேரளா கடலோர பகுதிகள், லட்சத்தீவு, மாலைத்தீவு பகுதிகளில் சூறாவளி காற்று மணிக்கு 35 முதல் 45 கி.மீ. வேகத்திலும், இடையிடையே 55 கிலோ மீட்டர் வேகத்திலும் வீசக்கூடும். எனவே மீனவர்கள் இந்த நாட்களில் இப்பகுதிகளுக்கு செல்ல வேண்டாம் என அறிவுறுத்தப்படுகிறார்கள். இவ்வாறு அதில் கூறப்பட்டுள்ளது.

title: Tamil Nadu: Delta-based weatherman predicts good monsoon - dtnext
article_text:
TIRUCHY: While a section of farmers was sceptical about achieving the kuruvai target, the Delta-based individual weatherman Thagattur N Selvakumar built the confidence of the farmers by predicting a good spell of monsoon rains.
Selvakumar said the monsoon rains would lash for at least 10 days from June 13, and the storage in Mettur would be maintained at 115 feet with 85 TMC water.
While the southwest monsoon would pick up in Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu along the Western Ghats from June 13.
This would fill up Kabini between June 15 and 20, and the excess water would be released to Mettur. Similarly, Harangi and Hemavathy reservoirs are also filling fast, and Krishna Raja Sagar would also touch the brim by June end, said Selvakumar.
“Since the excess water from Kabini and Krishna Raja Sagar would be released to Mettur, the water storage would be maintained and by June end, the Mettur would reach its full capacity and the monsoon rains would also pick up in July and it would result into release of excess water from Kollidam,” said Selvakumar.
Selvakumar also said, despite rainfall during August will be comparatively less, the monsoon would pick up from September, and so, the water flow in the Cauvery would be steady and the tail end parts of Delta would also receive adequate water, he said and added that the entire season would be favourable for farmers.

title: Chennai, Tamil Nadu Weather Update: IMD issues yellow alert, predicts heavy rain in 9 districts - MSN
article_text:
Heavy rainfall continues across Tamil Nadu due to the northeast monsoon. The Meteorological Department has issued a heavy rain warning for 9 districts.
Heavy rainfall occurred across all districts in Tamil Nadu due to the northeast monsoon. Intermittent rain has been occurring in various parts of Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, for the past few days. With the northeast monsoon reaching its final stage, the Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rainfall in 9 districts.
A low-pressure area persists over the southwest Bay of Bengal, off the Tamil Nadu coast. Consequently, light to moderate rain with thunder and lightning is expected in many places in coastal Tamil Nadu, a few places in interior Tamil Nadu, and Puducherry and Karaikal today. Light fog is common in the morning. Heavy rain is likely in Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, Ramanathapuram, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai, and Pudukkottai districts.
Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window.
A series of severe rains accompanied by severe lightning and thunderstorms triggered by early monsoon activity have claimed the lives of at least 25 people across several states in India, with most fatalities being caused by lightning strikes. The incidents have been reported from Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat, Delhi, Maharashtra and Himachal Pradesh over the last 24 hours.
In Uttar Pradesh, widespread lightning strikes have caused several deaths. In Ballia district, a 13-year-old girl was killed after being struck by lightning. Two others were injured and are undergoing treatment at the district hospital.
In Bijnor, three people lost their lives â two to lightning and one young girl who drowned in an overflowing drain while bathing in rainwater. The drowning incident occurred in the Raghgan area under Kiratpur police station, and the search for the missing girl is still ongoing.
In Yamunanagar's Bara area, tragedy struck the Sonbarsa village, where a family of four were killed in a lightning strike around midnight. On the other hand, in Auraiya district, lightning claimed three lives, including that of a 16-year-old. Two more were injured and are hospitalised.
In Sambhal, where lightning hit six people while they were harvesting crops in Maulanpur Danda in the Rajpura police station area. A teenage girl was killed, while others sustained severe burn injuries and were referred to a hospital in Aligarh.

title: Tamil Nadu rains: Heavy downpour disrupt normal life in Nilgiris; Schools closed, Orange Alert issued - News9live
article_text:
Chennai: Due to relentless heavy rains lashing the Nilgiris district, authorities have announced the closure of schools in several taluks, including Udhagamandalam (Ooty), Kundah, Gudalur, and Pandalur, on Monday, June 16, 2025. The decision comes following an orange alert issued by the India Meteorological Department (IMD), warning of extremely heavy rainfall in the region. Over the past few days, areas such as Avalanche, Parson Valley, and Bhavani have recorded exceptionally high rainfall, with Avalanche receiving 16 cm of rain in just 24 hours.
The district administration has advised residents to exercise caution, particularly in landslide-prone zones. Continuous downpours have already led to waterlogging in low-lying areas, disrupting road connectivity in some parts. The Collector has urged people to avoid unnecessary travel and stay updated with official weather advisories.
Southwest Monsoon Intensifies Across Tamil Nadu and Neighboring States
The early onset of the southwest monsoon has brought widespread rainfall across Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, and Maharashtra. Unlike previous years, the monsoon arrived as early as May this year, leading to prolonged wet spells. Private weather blogger Pradeep John known as Tamil Nadu weatherman has warned of “very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall” in Nilgiris and Valparai on Monday, with places like Devala, Nelliam, and Melbhavani likely to be severely affected.
Similar weather conditions are expected in Coimbatore, Tiruppur, Dindigul, Theni, and Tenkasi districts over the next 48 hours. Meanwhile, Kerala’s Wayanad, Idukki, and Karnataka’s Kodagu and Chikmagalur districts are also on high alert, with authorities recommending that tourists avoid these regions until June 18 due to the risk of landslides and flooding.
Chennai Experiences Moderate Rains; More Showers Expected
While the Nilgiris and western districts face intense rainfall, Chennai and its suburbs have seen comparatively milder weather. The city recorded partly cloudy skies with moderate evening showers in some areas, including Madipakkam, Meenambakkam, and Guindy. The IMD has forecast similar conditions over the next few days, with occasional spells of rain expected in the evenings.
The early monsoon has brought relief from the usual scorching June heat, with temperatures remaining relatively lower than average. However, officials continue to monitor the situation closely, particularly in vulnerable regions where excessive rainfall could lead to flooding and infrastructure damage. Residents are advised to stay alert and follow updates from local authorities as the monsoon progresses.

title: Chennai Weather Update: Moderate Rainfall Is Forecasted In These Region Of Tamil Nadu; Check More Details - MSN
article_text:
Chennai: After a brief dry spell, rains have returned to Tamil Nadu, with moderate to heavy showers reported across numerous districts over the past few days. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in numerous districts of Tamil Nadu, including Chennai. The minimum and maximum temperatures are likely to be around 28 degrees Celsius and 36 degrees Celsius, respectively. The humidity is expected to be around 70 per cent. The wind is expected to blow from the West at 19 km/h.
A yellow alert has been issued in these regions
The IMD has issued a yellow alert in numerous regions, including Nilgiris, Theni, Coimbatore, Thiruppur, Dindigul, Thenkasi, Cuddalore, Kanniyakumari, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam, Thiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Karikal, Chennai, Kanchipuram, Chengalpattu, Ranipet, Vellore, Tirivanamali, Villupuram, and Kallakurichi. The weather department said that moderate to heavy rainfall is predicted in these regions of Tamil Nadu and it is likely to be accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning.
The AQI in the city is likely to stand at 85, which indicates moderate air quality in the city. Some people who are less sensitive to air pollution may also have problems. Sensitive people may face more problems. The higher the AQI, the higher the level of air pollution and the greater the health concern. An AQI of 50 or less indicates good air quality, while an AQI of more than 300 indicates hazardous air quality.

Weather forecast for the next five days
June 10: Partly cloudy skies with light rain and thunderstorms expected. The minimum and maximum temperatures will likely range around 28 degrees Celsius and 38 degrees Celsius.
June 11: Partly cloudy conditions with light to moderate rain is forecasted for Wednesday.
June 12- 15: Partly cloudy with light rainfall is anticipated.

Bengaluru: The Namma Metro Yellow Line is expected to begin operations by June 2025. The metro route, starting from Rashtreeya Vidyalaya (R.V.) Road to Bommasandra, aims to provide much-needed relief to commuters struggling with Bengaluru’s heavy traffic.
Full-scale services have yet to commence, authorities plan to initially open seven stations, including both terminal points. In the early phase, only three train sets will be in operation, running at 30-minute intervals due to a limited number of driverless trains. The third train set arrived at the Hebbagodi depot on May 13, with trial runs scheduled to begin soon, according to a report by Times Property.
ALSO READ: Bengaluru Namma Metro Commuters Slam BMRCL After Trains Seen Wrapped With Ads
Officials from Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) have confirmed that full operations across all 16 stations are expected by August or September 2025, pending the arrival of additional train sets and required safety approvals.
The Yellow Line is a vital component of Phase 2 of the Namma Metro project. Spanning approximately 18.82 kilometres, it connects R.V. Road in the south to Bommasandra in the east. This corridor links key residential neighborhoods, tech hubs, and industrial zones, making it a significant advancement for Bengaluru’s public transportation network.
With traffic congestion a daily challenge for Bengaluru residents, the Yellow Line is expected to reduce commute times, decrease reliance on private vehicles, and support the city’s transition toward sustainable, eco-friendly mobility.
The Yellow Line features a fully elevated track with 16 stations designed to serve high-traffic areas and enhance accessibility across Bengaluru. Key stations include:
R.V. Road – Connects with the Green Line
Jayadeva Hospital – Provides vital access to the hospital
B.T.M. Layout – Serves a densely populated neighborhood
Silk Board – Alleviates congestion at a notorious traffic hotspot
H.S.R. Layout – Supports a major IT and residential area
Oxford College – Convenient for students and staff
Electronic City Phase 1 – Crucial for tech professionals
Bommasandra – Terminal station serving industrial and residential commuters
Other stations, Muneshwara Nagar, Central Silk Board, Bommanahalli, Hongasandra, Kudlu Gate, Singasandra, Basapura, and Hosa Road, have been strategically chosen to serve busy and growing localities.
Once operational, the Yellow Line will run daily from 5:00 AM to 11:00 PM. During peak hours, trains will arrive every 10 minutes, while off-peak intervals will extend to 15 minutes. These timings are designed to provide flexible travel options for early morning workers, students, and late-night commuters alike.
ALSO READ: Bengaluru Namma Metro Update: Commute Service Sees Record Footfall Of 10 Lakh In A Day Amid RCB Celebrations
Fares on the Yellow Line will range from Rs 15 to Rs 85, based on the distance traveled. Commuters will have the option to use smart cards, QR code-based tickets, or traditional paper tickets. Additionally, digital payment methods will be available to provide a seamless and cashless travel experience.

title: Maharashtra Weather Forecast : रायगडला रेड अलर्ट, अतितीव्र मुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता; मुंबईसह कोल्हापूर, पुणे, कोकणात आठवडाभर कसं असेल हवामान? - Maharashtra Times
article_text:
मुंबई : राज्यभरात पाऊस सक्रिय झाला असून, सोमवारपर्यंत विदर्भाच्या काही भागांत मान्सून दाखल होण्याची शक्यता वर्तविण्यात आली आहे. पावसाला पुन्हा चालना मिळताना काही ठिकाणी पावसाचा जोरही वाढला आहे. कोकणामध्ये रत्नागिरी, डहाणू येथे रविवारी सकाळी ८.३० पर्यंतच्या २४ तासांमध्ये मुसळधार पाऊस नोंदला गेला, तर मुंबईमध्येही दिवसभरात तुरळक ठिकाणी पावसाचा जोर वाढलेला होता. रत्नागिरी जिल्ह्यात रविवारीही मध्यम स्वरूपाचा पाऊस सुरू होता. दुपारनंतर पावसाने काहीशी विश्रांती घेतली. रत्नागिरी जिल्ह्यात लांजा, राजापूर, रत्नागिरी, खेड, दापोली आणि सिंधुदुर्ग जिल्ह्यात मालवण, कुडाळ, देवगड परिसरात पावसामुळे काही ठिकाणी नुकसान झाल्याच्या घटना घडल्या आहेत.

शनिवारी सकाळी ८.३० ते रविवारी सकाळी ८.३० वाजेपर्यंत मुंबईमध्ये कुलाबा येथे ३३.६, तर सांताक्रूझ येथे १८.६ मिलीमीटर पावसाची नोंद झाली. त्यानंतर दिवसभर आकाश ढगाळलेले होते. दिवसभरात दक्षिण मुंबईत तुलनेने अधिक पाऊस होता.

Marathwada Rain : मराठवाड्यात सर्वदूर मुसळधार पाऊस, वादळी पावसाने केळी बागांचे नुकसान; वीज कोसळून चौघांचा मृत्यू


रायगडला ‘रेड अलर्ट’

चिपळूण : प्रादेशिक हवामान विभागाने वर्तवलेल्या अंदाजानुसार, रायगड येथे सोमवारसाठी ‘रेड अलर्ट’ दिला असून तुरळक ठिकाणी अतितीव्र मुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता आहे. रत्नागिरी, सिंधुदुर्ग येथे ‘ऑरेंज अलर्ट’ देण्यात आला आहे. काही ठिकाणी मुसळधार ते अतिमुसळधार पावसाचा अंदाज आहे. मुंबई आणि ठाणे जिल्ह्यात सोमवारसाठी ‘यलो अलर्ट’ देण्यात आला आहे. सोमवारी काही ठिकाणी मुसळधार पाऊस पडू शकेल. त्यानंतर मंगळवारी, बुधवारी मध्यम स्वरूपाच्या पावसाचा अंदाज आहे. उर्वरित राज्यात पुणे आणि कोल्हापूर घाट परिसरात; तसेच साताऱ्याच्या घाट परिसरात सोमवारसाठी ‘ऑरेंज ॲलर्ट’ देण्यात आला आहे. सोमवारी विदर्भापर्यंत मान्सून पोहोचण्याची शक्यता असून, सोमवार ते गुरुवार या चार दिवसांमध्ये येथे मेघगर्जनेसह पावसाची शक्यता वर्तवण्यात आली आहे.

Thane Rain Update : पावसाळ्यातील ५६ दिवस धोक्याचे, आपत्ती विभागाची महत्त्वाची माहिती; जनजीवन विस्कळीत होण्याची शक्यता


पूल गेला वाहून

बेळगाव : बेळगाव-गोवा मार्गावरील कुसमळी येथील पूल वाहून गेल्यामुळे चोर्लामार्गे गोव्याला जाणारा रस्ता शनिवारी मध्यरात्री पासून बंद झाला आहे. यामुळे गोव्याला जाणारी वाहतूक बैलूर व खानापूरमार्गे वळविण्यात आली आहे. बेळगावहून गोव्याला भाजीपाला, दूध आदी पुरवठा करणारी वाहने चोर्लामार्गे जातात. पण नदीवरील रस्ता वाहून गेल्याने आता या मार्गांवरील वाहतूक ठप्प झाली आहे.
बेळगाव-चोर्ला-गोवा मार्गावर कुसमळी येथे नवीन पूल बांधण्यात येत असल्याने, बाजूला पर्यायी रस्ता तयार करण्यात आला होता. परंतु, जांबोटी परिसरात मोठ्या प्रमाणात पाऊस झाल्याने पाण्याचा प्रवाह मोठ्या प्रमाणात वाढला व त्यामध्ये पर्यायी मार्ग वाहून गेला. सध्या जांबोटी परिसरात पावसाचे प्रमाण मोठ्या प्रमाणात वाढल्याने मलप्रभा नदीला पूर आला आहे.

२ दगावले, ६ गंभीर जखमी, ३८ जणांना बाहेर काढलं; पूल कोसळताच घटनास्थळी थरार, VIDEO समोर!


धरण भरले

सोलापूर : तुळजापूरमधील बोरी व हरणा नदीच्या परिसरात झालेल्या जोरदार पावसामुळे अक्कलकोट तालुक्यातील कुरनूर धरणाची पाणीपातळी जून महिन्याच्या सुरुवातीलाच १०० टक्क्यांवर पोहोचली आहे. २१ वर्षांच्या इतिहासात पहिल्यांदाच १५ जूनच्या आत हे धरण पूर्ण भरले आहे.



राज्यमार्ग अवजड वाहतुकीसाठी बंद

रत्नागिरी जिल्ह्यात महत्त्वाचा राज्यमार्ग असलेल्या दापोली-खेड या प्रमुख राज्यमार्गाचे काम गेले कित्येक दिवस सुरू आहे. अशातच जवळपास १५ मेपासूनच पावसाला मोठ्या प्रमाणात सुरुवात झाल्याने या कामात अनेक अडथळे निर्माण झाले आहेत. गेले दोन दिवस झालेल्या मोठ्या पावसाने या मार्गावरील खेड तालुक्यातील फुरुस येथील मोरी वाहून गेली आहे. या मोरीचे व सेवारस्त्याचे काम योग्य प्रकारे होण्यासाठी मार्गावरून अवजड वाहनांची वाहतूक २२ जूनपर्यंत बंद करण्यात आली आहे.

title: Heavy rain forecast for Maharashtra today, red alert issued in Raigad - Suryaa
article_text:
Mumbai, June 16 (IANS) As the monsoon has become active, the Meteorological Department said the intensity of rains will increase throughout the day on Monday and issued alerts for various regions of Maharashtra.
It has issued a red alert in Raigad district, orange alert in Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg, Pune ghat section, Satara ghat section, Kolhapur ghat section and yellow alert in Mumbai, Palghar, Thane, Nashik ghat section, Nagpur, Bhandara, Gondia, Gadchiroli.
The weather bureau has predicted thunderstorms with lightning likely in Buldhana, Akola, Amravati, Washim, Yavatmal, Wardha, Nagpur, Bhandara, Gondia, Chandrapur and Gadchiroli districts.
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in its post on X said, “The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a warning of heavy rains in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (Mumbai city and suburbs) for next three hours. For help in an emergency or for official, contact the BMC’s main control room helpline number 1916.”
Due to the rain, the Central, Western and Harbour Railways in Mumbai are running late by 5 to 10 minutes. Heavy rainfall has been continuing in the Vasai-Virar area since Sunday evening, and many low-lying areas of the city have been submerged. As a result, traffic and normal life have been disrupted.
The state government sources said the respective Divisional Commissioners and District Collectors have been asked to keep vigil and be prepared to conduct relief rescue works. The state emergency operations centre situated at Mantralaya has been in touch with all districts to streamline relief and rescue works.
“There is a cyclonic circulation over South Central Maharashtra and its vicinity at a height of 7.6 km above sea level. Cyclonic circulation is also prevailing over the Bay of Bengal at a height of 3.1 to 7.6 km above sea level. Due to this, the monsoon has now become active. The Meteorological Department has predicted that the monsoon will advance over Vidarbha, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh and Odisha as the weather is conducive for the advance of the monsoon,” said state government sources.
Mumbai and Pune cities have been receiving continuous rain since the night. Heavy rain has been recorded in the Pune area since night, 113 mm of rain has been recorded in the Varandha Ghat Shirgaon area, while there has been a drizzle in the Mutha Ghat leading to Lavasa.
The weather bureau has predicted that the intensity of rain will decrease in Mumbai and Thane on Tuesday and Wednesday, and there will be moderate rain.

title: Maharashtra Weather: Heavy Rain Forecast for Next 48 Hours; Red Alert Issued for Several Districts, Authorities Urge Caution - PUNE PULSE
article_text:
Latest News
Maharashtra Weather: Heavy Rain Forecast for Next 48 Hours; Red Alert Issued for Several Districts, Authorities Urge Caution
 Punepulse  June 16, 2025

Maharashtra Weather: Heavy Rain Forecast for Next 48 Hours; Red Alert Issued for Several Districts, Authorities Urge Caution

Share This News

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for several coastal districts in Maharashtra as extremely heavy rainfall is expected over the next 48 hours. The warning primarily covers parts of the Konkan region, with Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg predicted to experience intense downpours.

Widespread rainfall activity began Saturday evening across most parts of the state and is expected to intensify further. According to IMD, Mumbai and surrounding suburbs will witness heavy to very heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms over the next two days. Meanwhile, Thane, Raigad, and Palghar districts have been placed under a yellow alert, while an orange alert has been issued for several other parts of Konkan.

In Ratnagiri and Raigad, torrential rainfall has already triggered flood-like conditions. Several areas in Mangao, Mahad, and Roha witnessed cloudburst-like rain, with water entering homes and roads submerged. In Palshat, Guhagar, river overflow has led to flooding in adjacent residential areas. The Parshuram Ghat region also experienced severe waterlogging, causing significant traffic snarls.

IMG-20250324-WA0012

The IMD has extended the red alert for Ratnagiri through Sunday and issued a red alert for Sindhudurg on Monday, citing continued heavy to extremely heavy rainfall in the region. The rest of the Konkan belt remains under orange alert, while Mumbai has been placed under a yellow alert.

Despite the monsoon’s delayed progress in certain areas, it has now reactivated with strong intensity, particularly over central Maharashtra and coastal regions. The active phase of the monsoon is likely to persist, and several areas may continue to witness heavy showers in the coming days.

Balwadkar

Civic authorities have advised residents, especially in low-lying and landslide-prone areas, to remain alert and avoid unnecessary travel. Emergency response teams are on standby to deal with any untoward incidents arising from the adverse weather conditions.

article_text:
ADVERTISEMENT
Heavy Rains Lash Mumbai, IMD Issues Orange Alert For The City And Several Maharashtra Districts
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a warning on Monday for heavy rain in Mumbai and other coastal districts of Maharashtra.
NDTV Profit News
16 Jun 2025, 09:46 AM IST
i

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a warning about heavy rain in Mumbai and other coastal districts of Maharashtra, such as Raigad and Ratnagiri, among others, on June 16.

The weather agency has issued an orange alert for Mumbai for the next three hours, predicting heavy to very heavy rain in several parts of the city.

Following the heavy rainfall alert, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has issued emergency helpline numbers for the residents.

"The India Meteorological Department has issued a warning of heavy rain in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (Mumbai city and suburbs) for the next 3 hours. For help in an emergency or official information, contact the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's main control room helpline number 1916," the BMC said in a post on X on Monday morning.

#WATCH | Morning rain showers drench Mumbai; IMD has sounded an alert for heavy rain in the city today

Visuals from BPT, Wadala East pic.twitter.com/1tNkSRiADI

— ANI (@ANI) June 16, 2025

Earlier, visuals emerged from BPT, Wadala East, and other parts of Mumbai showing the city being battered by heavy rains, as commuters struggled to get back to work on Monday.

Besides coastal districts, Pune and Satara are also on a yellow alert till 10 a.m., according to the IMD. No alert has been issued for the remaining districts of Maharashtra.

ALSO READ
Monsoon To Advance In Some Parts Of Bengal Next Week
Weather In Coastal Districts Of Maharashtra

Overall, Mumbai has been put on a yellow alert by the IMD for the whole day as "heavy" rainfall at a few places is "very likely" in the city. Palghar and Thane are also on a yellow alert. Meanwhile, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg coastal districts will remain on an orange alert. The IMD has issued a red alert for Raigad during this period.

The IMD has warned about isolated very heavy rainfall in central Maharashtra, Goa and the Konkan region between June 16 and 18. Further, isolated rainfall is expected to continue in central Maharashtra, Konkan and Goa from June 18 to 21, according to the weather agency.

Mumbai Weather Weekly Forecast

According to IMD's Santacruz weather station, Mumbai is expected to experience rainfall till June 22.

June 16: Generally cloudy sky with heavy rainfall expected (orange alert).

June 17- 19: Generally cloudy sky with intermittent rain (no warning).

June 19-22: Rain is likely in the city with no specific warning.

title: Pune weather: IMD predicts rainfall throughout the week, issues orange alert for ghat areas of Maharashtra - The Economic Times
article_text:
PTI
Pune rains
Maharashtra's Pune district is set to receive more rainfall throughout the week, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

The weather department has forecast generally cloudy skies along with light to moderate rain in the city until Thursday. However, rainfall may decrease by the weekend, it said. The forecast till Sunday said, "Partly cloudy sky becoming generally cloudy sky towards afternoon or evening. Light rain very likely."



IMD issues orange alert in Pune, other parts of Maharashtra
The ghat section of western Maharashtra received an orange alert. The areas include Pune, Kolhapur and Satara. Further, a red alert has been issued for Raigad for Monday.


Orange alert indicates very heavy rainfall, while red alert indicates extremely heavy rainfall.

"The cyclonic circulation over west-central Bay of Bengal off north Coastal Andhra Pradesh coast at 5.8km above mean sea level has merged with the above cyclonic circulation. The upper air cyclonic circulation over Marathwada now lies over South Madhya Maharashtra and neighbourhood and extends up to 7.6km above mean sea level, tilting southwestwards with height. Under its influence, the rainfall activity over Maharashtra is likely to continue during June 15-18," the weather department said.


According to IMD officials, the advancement of the monsoon is likely this week, covering the entire state. "Conditions are favourable for further advancement of the southwest monsoon over some parts of Gujarat, some more parts of Vidarbha, Chhattisgarh, and Odisha during the next 24 hours; over some parts of West Bengal, Jharkhand, Bihar, and east Uttar Pradesh during the subsequent three days," the forecast said.


The city and surrounding areas also witnessed light showers on Sunday afternoon and evening, which led to a marginal increase in rainfall. It included Shivajinagar (0.5 mm), Lavale (4.5 mm), and Koregaon Park (0.5 mm). Pashan areas recorded 7.9 mm of rain during this period.


Shivajinagar recorded the season's highest rainfall of 55 mm on Friday evening as thundershowers and lightning lashed the city, leading to waterlogging and severe traffic snarls across multiple areas.

Home / Mumbai
Maharashtra Weather Alert: Heavy Rains In Mumbai; High Tide Alert Issued by BMC
By Madhuri Adnal
 Published: Monday, June 16, 2025, 9:54 [IST]
  

Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall in the early hours of Monday, June 16, 2025, leading to waterlogging in several parts of the city. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), most of the rain occurred between 2 am and 5 am, with South Mumbai and the western suburbs being the most affected.

The IMD has issued an orange alert, predicting heavy to very heavy rainfall for the rest of the day in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region, which includes Mumbai city and suburbs.

title: Heavy rains in Mumbai and suburbs till 10 am, IMD issues orange alert - CNBC TV18
article_text:
Heavy rains in Mumbai and suburbs till 10 am, IMD issues orange alert
The IMD said the monsoon is likely to be in the active phase with heavy to very heavy rainfall at a few places and extremely heavy falls (>20 cm) at isolated places over south peninsular India and Konkan and Goa till June 16.
By Santia Gora   
June 16, 2025, 9:30:40 AM IST (Updated)
2 Min Read
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Navi Mumbai, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg till 10 am on Monday (June 16).







The IMD said the monsoon is likely to be in the active phase with heavy to very heavy rainfall at a few places and extremely heavy falls (>20 cm) at isolated places over south peninsular India and Konkan and Goa till June 16.




On Sunday (June 15), at least eight persons were killed, mostly due to lightning strikes, as heavy rains pummelled parts of Maharashtra.




As per the state disaster management report, Ratnagiri recorded the highest rainfall at 88.1 mm, followed by Raigad with 65.3 mm, Sindhudurg with 43.8 mm, Thane with 29.6 mm, and Yavatmal with 27.5 mm, in 24 hours ending at 11 am.

Among major rivers in the Konkan region, the Jagbudi River in Ratnagiri district is flowing above the warning level, and Khed, Alsure, Chinchghar and Prabhuwadi villages on its banks may be affected if the water level rises, the disaster management report stated.

title: Mumbai: IMD warns of thunderstorms, rain in city and several districts across Maharashtra - Mid-day
article_text:
16 June,2025 10:33 AM IST |  Mumbai  |  mid-day online correspondent
Thunderstorms with lightning and gusty winds (up to 60 km/h) are predicted for many districts in state. File Pic
On Monday, Mumbai is experiencing generally cloudy skies with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasting heavy rainfall at a few places across the city and its suburbs.
Over the past 24 hours, the city has received substantial rain, with the City (CT) zone recording 95 mm, the Eastern Suburbs (ES) 58 mm, and the Western Suburbs (WS) 75 mm.
Citizens are advised to stay alert, especially in low-lying areas, as the rainfall may lead to localised waterlogging. Alongside the rain, high tide conditions are expected today at 15:31 hrs with sea levels reaching 4.21 metres, which could further contribute to flooding in coastal areas.
The next high tide is predicted early tomorrow morning, June 17, at 03:31 hrs, measuring 3.44 metres. Meanwhile, low tide is expected tonight at 21:41 hrs at 1.86 metres, followed by another at 09:10 hrs tomorrow at 1.33 metres.
Mumbai: Kandivali school receives bomb threat; police begin investigation
Mumbai: Road caves in at Girgaon, BEST bus wheel gets stuck
Heavy rain forecast for Maharashtra today, red alert issued in Raigad
Uttar Pradesh: Light rain, gusty winds bring respite from scorching heat in Ayod
Mumbai: Uddhav exhorts cadres to meet masses and uphold Sena legacy
With continued showers likely and tidal activity peaking, the civic authorities are monitoring the situation closely, and residents are urged to avoid venturing into waterlogged zones or coastal stretches during high tide periods.
Heavy to very heavy rainfall is forecasted in coastal districts such as Mumbai, Palghar, Thane, Raigad, Ratnagiri, and Sindhudurg over the next few days, with some places expected to see extremely heavy rainfall, as per IMD.
Thunderstorms with lightning and gusty winds (up to 60 km/h) are predicted for many districts in the state.
Parts of Maharashtra, such as Nashik, Dhule, Jalgaon, Nandurbar, and Ahmednagar, are expected to receive moderate to light rain, along with thunderstorms and gusty winds.
Vidarbha region, including Nagpur, Chandrapur, Akola, and Amravati, will likely experience thunderstorms with lightning and localised gusty winds.
The probability of rain-related events in all districts is marked as "Very Likely" throughout the forecast period.
Warnings Issued:
Risk of cloud-to-ground lightning, fall of weak trees, and power disruptions.
Potential damage to crops, plantations, and kutcha houses due to unseasonal rains and winds.
The public is advised to avoid open fields, stay indoors during thunderstorms, and not seek shelter under trees.
Agromet Advisory:
Farmers are advised to harvest mature crops early, protect stored grains, support young plants, and avoid irrigation or pesticide spraying.
Ensure safe shelter for cattle and arrange proper drainage in fields to avoid crop loss.

title: Mumbai Weather Update: मुंबई में आज होगी भारी बारिश, IMD ने ज्वार के उच्चतम स्तर के लिए जारी की चेतावनी - Hindi Mid-day
article_text:
होम > मुंबई > मुंबई न्यूज़ > आर्टिकल > मुंबई में आज होगी भारी बारिश, IMD ने ज्वार के उच्चतम स्तर के लिए जारी की चेतावनी
मुंबई में आज होगी भारी बारिश, IMD ने ज्वार के उच्चतम स्तर के लिए जारी की चेतावनी

Updated on: 16 June, 2025 08:31 AM IST | Mumbai
Hindi Mid-day Online Correspondent | hmddigital@mid-day.com

Share:    Linked Follow Us

मुंबई में आज (15 जून 2025) भारी वर्षा का अलर्ट जारी किया गया है, जिसमें शहर और उपनगरों में कुछ स्थानों पर तेज बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है.

Representational Image / Pic: Anurag Ahire

मुंबई का मौसम आज (15 जून 2025) सुबह 8 बजे के पूर्वानुमान के अनुसार सामान्य रूप से बादल छाए रहेंगे, और शहर तथा उपनगरों में कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना जताई गई है. मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, भारी बारिश के साथ-साथ कुछ जगहों पर तेज हवाएं भी चल सकती हैं, जो जलभराव और यातायात में समस्याएं उत्पन्न कर सकती हैं.

ADVERTISEMENT

बीएमसी (बृहन्मुंबई नगर निगम) द्वारा जारी किए गए ताजा मौसम रिपोर्ट में बताया गया है कि इस समय मुंबई और आसपास के क्षेत्रों में मानसून पूरी तरह से सक्रिय हो चुका है. आइलैंड सिटी में 95 मिमी वर्षा होने का अनुमान है, जबकि पूर्वी उपनगरों में 58 मिमी और पश्चिमी उपनगरों में 75 मिमी वर्षा हो सकती है. इस भारी वर्षा के कारण शहर की सड़कों पर जलभराव और ट्रैफिक जाम जैसी समस्याओं का सामना किया जा सकता है.




ज्वार की स्थिति:




आज का ज्वार का उच्चतम स्तर दोपहर 3.31 बजे 4.21 मीटर तक पहुंचने की संभावना है, जबकि निम्न ज्वार रात 9.41 बजे 1.86 मीटर रहेगा. अगले दिन (17 जून 2025) की स्थिति में सुबह 3.31 बजे उच्च ज्वार 3.44 मीटर होगा, जबकि निम्न ज्वार सुबह 9.10 बजे 1.33 मीटर रहेगा.

मौसम विभाग ने लोगों को सलाह दी है कि वे समुद्र किनारे पर जाने से बचें, खासकर ज्वार के उच्चतम स्तर के दौरान, क्योंकि समुद्र का पानी चढ़ सकता है और सुरक्षा के लिहाज से यह खतरनाक हो सकता है.




आज के मौसम में सुरक्षा उपाय:

इस प्रकार की भारी वर्षा में सड़कें गीली और फिसलन भरी हो सकती हैं, जिससे वाहन चालकों को विशेष सावधानी बरतने की आवश्यकता है. इसके अलावा, जलभराव के कारण स्थानीय परिवहन व्यवस्था भी प्रभावित हो सकती है, जिससे यात्रियों को असुविधा हो सकती है. बीएमसी ने सुनिश्चित किया है कि नगर निगम की टीमें संभावित जलभराव वाले क्षेत्रों में मुस्तैदी से काम करेंगी और समस्या को जल्दी हल करने का प्रयास करेंगी.

मुंबईवासियों से निवेदन किया गया है कि वे मौसम के हालात के अनुसार यात्रा करें और वर्षा से बचने के लिए उचित तैयारी रखें.

title: Weather Update: समूचे भारत में अनायास बारिश, आंधी, बिजली, मुंबई में भारी बारिश, MP में अनिश्चितता - Mediawala
article_text:
Weather Update: समूचे भारत में अनायास बारिश, आंधी, बिजली, मुंबई में भारी बारिश, MP में अनिश्चितता
By Mediawala -
June 16, 2025
121
Weather Update: समूचे भारत में अनायास बारिश, आंधी, बिजली, मुंबई में भारी बारिश, MP में अनिश्चितता

 

दिनेश सोलंकी की खास रिपोर्ट

 

इस समय गोलाकार मानसून चल रहा है जिसने भारत के लगभग सभी राज्यों में पैर पसार लिए हैं। जबकि पश्चिमी विक्षोभ हवाओं संग भारत के शीर्ष पर ही है लेकिन उत्तर पूर्वी मानसून बंगाल की खाड़ी से चलकर दक्षिण से लेकर उत्तर भारत तक फैल गया है, सभी ओर तेज हवा, आंधी और बिजली चमकने गिरने के हालात बन रहे हैं। कुल मिलाकर लग रहा है मानसून तेज रफ्तार से बहुत जल्दी में सफर पर है।

 

मुंबई में अगले 4 दिन में दो बार भारी बारिश की संभावना है। गुजरात में आज कई जगह भारी बारिश हो सकती है खासकर दक्षिण पश्चिम भाग में। यहां से बादल उत्तर की ओर राजस्थान, पंजाब, कश्मीर, हिमाचल और लद्दाख का चक्कर लगाकर उत्तराखंड, यूपी, बिहार से टर्न ले रहे हैं, वहीं बंगाल की खाड़ी के बादल दक्षिण राज्यों से घूमकर महाराष्ट्र पहुंच रहे हैं। इन सभी राज्यों में बादल, बारिश, बिजली, आंधी की स्थिति भी निर्मित है।

 

उत्तरी राज्यों में 30 जून तक पर्यटन के लिहाज से खतरा है, बारिश, भूस्खलन का डर रह सकता है, इसलिए सावथानी जरूरी होगी।

 

इधर मध्य प्रदेश में मौसम की अनिश्चितता बनी हुई है हालांकि यहां महाराष्ट्र और यूपी, दिल्ली के रास्ते भी मानसूनी बादल मिल रहे हैं इसलिए अनायास बारिश की संभावना रहेगी। पश्चिम भाग में बारिश का असर प्रभावी हो सकता है। दोपहर बाद से मौसम में परिवर्तन हवाओं से हो सकता है। आंधी की संभावना भी रहेगी।

title: Punjab Rain Alert: ਪੰਜਾਬ ਵਿਚ ਅੱਜ ਭਾਰੀ ਮੀਂਹ! ਇਸ ਦਿਨ ਤੱਕ ਲਗਾਤਾਰ ਵਰ੍ਹਣਗੇ ਬੱਦਲ, IMD ਨੇ ਜਾਰੀ ਕੀਤੀ ਚੇਤਾਵਨੀ - News18 Punjab
article_text:
Punjab Weather News | ਪੰਜਾਬ 'ਚ ਤਪਦੀ ਗਰਮੀ ਦਾ ਕਹਿਰ, ਕਿਵੇਂ ਝੋਨਾ ਲਗਾਉਣਗੇ ਲੋਕ? | Sangrur News

Amritsar News | ਤੱਪਦੀ ਗਰਮੀ ਨੂੰ ਲੈ ਕੇ ਦਰਬਾਰ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਤੋਂ ਆਈ ਇਹ ਖ਼ਬਰ | Darbar Sahib News | #local18
ਪੰਜਾਬ ਅਤੇ ਚੰਡੀਗੜ੍ਹ ਦੇ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਗਰਮੀ ਤੋਂ ਕੁਝ ਰਾਹਤ ਮਿਲੀ ਹੈ। ਪਿਛਲੇ 24 ਘੰਟਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ, ਸੂਬੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਾਪਮਾਨ 4.9 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਯਾਨੀ ਲਗਭਗ 5 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਘਟਿਆ ਹੈ। ਹੁਣ ਤਾਪਮਾਨ ਆਮ ਦੇ ਨੇੜੇ ਪਹੁੰਚ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ। ਬਠਿੰਡਾ ਸੂਬੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਗਰਮ ਸੀ, ਜਿੱਥੇ ਤਾਪਮਾਨ 42.2 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਦਰਜ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ।
ਅੱਜ 12 ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਹਲਕੀ ਤੋਂ ਦਰਮਿਆਨੀ ਬਾਰਿਸ਼ ਹੋਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਹੀ ਛੇ ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹਿਆਂ ਪਠਾਨਕੋਟ, ਹੁਸ਼ਿਆਰਪੁਰ, ਨਵਾਂਸ਼ਹਿਰ, ਰੂਪਨਗਰ, ਮੋਹਾਲੀ ਅਤੇ ਪਟਿਆਲਾ ਵਿੱਚ ਗਰਜ-ਤੂਫ਼ਾਨ ਦਾ ਪੀਲਾ ਅਲਰਟ ਜਾਰੀ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ। ਇਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਇਲਾਕਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ 50 ਤੋਂ 60 ਕਿਲੋਮੀਟਰ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਘੰਟਾ ਦੀ ਰਫ਼ਤਾਰ ਨਾਲ ਹਵਾਵਾਂ ਚੱਲਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਦੌਰਾਨ ਬਿਜਲੀ ਵੀ ਚਮਕੇਗੀ। ਚੰਡੀਗੜ੍ਹ ਵਿੱਚ ਤਾਪਮਾਨ 4 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਘੱਟ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ, ਜਿਸ ਕਾਰਨ ਇਹ ਹੁਣ 37.7 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਤੱਕ ਪਹੁੰਚ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਹੀ, 20 ਤਰੀਕ ਤੱਕ ਕੋਈ ਹੀਟਵੇਵ ਅਲਰਟ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਬਾਰਿਸ਼ ਦੀ ਲੜੀ ਜਾਰੀ ਰਹੇਗੀ।
ਅੱਜ 23 ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੌਸਮ ਇਸ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਰਹੇਗਾ
ਭਾਰਤੀ ਮੌਸਮ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਦੇ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ, ਰੂਪਨਗਰ, ਮੋਹਾਲੀ, ਪਟਿਆਲਾ, ਪਠਾਨਕੋਟ, ਹੁਸ਼ਿਆਰਪੁਰ, ਨਵਾਂਸ਼ਹਿਰ, ਫਤਿਹਗੜ੍ਹ ਸਾਹਿਬ, ਲੁਧਿਆਣਾ, ਬਰਨਾਲਾ, ਸੰਗਰੂਰ, ਮਾਨਸਾ ਅਤੇ ਬਠਿੰਡਾ ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੁਝ ਥਾਵਾਂ ‘ਤੇ ਹਲਕੀ ਤੋਂ ਦਰਮਿਆਨੀ ਬਾਰਿਸ਼ ਹੋਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਲ ਹੀ, ਪਠਾਨਕੋਟ, ਹੁਸ਼ਿਆਰਪੁਰ, ਨਵਾਂਸ਼ਹਿਰ, ਰੂਪਨਗਰ, ਐਸਏਐਸ ਨਗਰ (ਮੋਹਾਲੀ) ਅਤੇ ਪਟਿਆਲਾ ਜ਼ਿਲ੍ਹਿਆਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੁਝ ਥਾਵਾਂ ‘ਤੇ ਗਰਜ, ਬਿਜਲੀ ਅਤੇ ਤੇਜ਼ ਹਵਾਵਾਂ (40-50 ਕਿਲੋਮੀਟਰ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਘੰਟਾ ਦੀ ਰਫ਼ਤਾਰ) ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ।
20 ਜੂਨ ਤੱਕ ਮੀਂਹ ਪੈਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ
ਮੌਸਮ ਵਿਭਾਗ ਦੇ ਅਨੁਸਾਰ, ਅਗਲੇ 24 ਘੰਟਿਆਂ ਤੱਕ ਰਾਜ ਵਿੱਚ ਵੱਧ ਤੋਂ ਵੱਧ ਤਾਪਮਾਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੋਈ ਵੱਡਾ ਬਦਲਾਅ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੋਵੇਗਾ। ਇਸ ਤੋਂ ਬਾਅਦ, ਤਾਪਮਾਨ ਹੌਲੀ-ਹੌਲੀ 3-5 ਡਿਗਰੀ ਸੈਲਸੀਅਸ ਤੱਕ ਘਟਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ। 15 ਤੋਂ ਲੈਕੇ 20 ਤਰੀਕ ਤੱਕ ਕੁਝ ਥਾਵਾਂ ‘ਤੇ ਹਲਕੀ ਤੋਂ ਦਰਮਿਆਨੀ ਬਾਰਿਸ਼ ਹੋਣ ਦੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ। 16 ਤੋਂ 21 ਤਰੀਕ ਤੱਕ ਵੱਖ-ਵੱਖ ਥਾਵਾਂ ‘ਤੇ ਗਰਜ, ਬਿਜਲੀ ਅਤੇ ਤੇਜ਼ ਹਵਾਵਾਂ (40-50 ਕਿਲੋਮੀਟਰ ਪ੍ਰਤੀ ਘੰਟਾ ਦੀ ਗਤੀ) ਦੀ ਵੀ ਸੰਭਾਵਨਾ ਹੈ।

title: Heavy Rain Alert: IMD Issues Red-Orange Alerts for Several States Until June 20th - Patrika News
article_text:
Pleasant Weather in Delhi-NCR, Rain Likely for 6 Days Delhi experienced a change in weather on Sunday morning. Heavy rain and thunderstorms brought relief from the intense heat. The meteorological department has issued a yellow alert for thunderstorms and rain in Delhi for six days. On Sunday, Delhi’s maximum temperature was recorded at 36°C and the minimum temperature at 20°C. A further drop is expected in the coming days.

Red Alert in Bihar, Rajasthan A red alert has been issued for Bihar and Rajasthan in view of heavy rain and strong winds. North Bihar, in particular, has been warned of heavy rain and lightning from 15 to 20 June. Meanwhile, the eastern parts of Rajasthan are expected to experience thunderstorms and torrential rain in the coming days.

Strong Winds and Rain in Haryana-Punjab and Hill States Haryana, Punjab, Uttarakhand, and Himachal Pradesh in North India are on alert for rain with thunder and lightning from 16 to 21 June. Hailstorms are also expected in northern Haryana on 16 June. Wind speeds could reach 70 km per hour in parts of Rajasthan and Himachal Pradesh.

Heavy Rainfall Warning in South India Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Karnataka, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh are likely to experience heavy rain with lightning and strong winds from 16 to 19 June. Widespread rainfall is expected in Kerala and Mahe.

Northeast and East India Also Affected An alert has been issued for heavy to very heavy rainfall in Guwahati for the next two to three days. The Assam State Disaster Management Authority has warned of waterlogging, traffic disruption, and the possibility of landslides in some vulnerable areas. Furthermore, heavy rain and lightning are possible in Odisha, Jharkhand, West Bengal, and Sikkim.

Heavy Rainfall Predicted for Konkan, Maharashtra, Gujarat Between 18 and 21 June, there is a likelihood of thunderstorms in parts of Konkan, Goa, central Maharashtra, and Gujarat. Due to the active monsoon, waterlogging and traffic disruption are possible in these areas.

title: Thunderstorm, heavy rainfall forecast - The News International
article_text:
LAHORE:Hot but partly cloudy weather was recorded in the City here on Sunday while Met office predicted windstorm/dust-thunderstorm /hailstorm/heavy rain falls and lightning during the next 24 hours.
Met officials said moist currents were approaching central and southern parts of the country while a westerly wave was also present over upper/central parts and likely to persist during next two days. They predicted that partly cloudy weather with dust/thunderstorm-rain was likely at isolated places in Kashmir, Gilgit-Baltistan, eastern Punjab, Potohar region, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Sindh and Northern Balochistan. Isolated hailstorm may also occur during the period. Hot and dry weather was likely elsewhere in the country while, very hot in plain areas. Rainfall was recorded at several cities across the country. Sunday's maximum temperature was observed at Noorpur Thal and Turbat where mercury reached 48°C, while in Lahore, it was 39°C.

title: Punjab Weather : आंधी-तूफान के साथ आएगी बारिश, इन जिलों के लिए जारी हुआ येलो अलर्ट - dainiksaveratimes.com
article_text:
Punjab Weather : पंजाब और चंडीगढ़ के लोगों को गर्मी से थोड़ी राहत मिली है। पिछले 24 घंटे में राज्य के तापमान में 4.9 डिग्री यानी करीब 5 डिग्री की गिरावट आई है। अब तापमान सामान्य के करीब पहुंच गया है। राज्य में बठिंडा सबसे गर्म रहा, जहां तापमान 42.2 डिग्री दर्ज किया गया।

येलो अलर्ट जारी

आज 12 जिलों में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश की संभावना है। इसके साथ ही छह जिलों पठानकोट, होशियारपुर, नवांशहर, रूपनगर, मोहाली और पटियाला में आंधी का येलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। इन इलाकों में 50 से 60 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से हवाएं चलने की संभावना है। चंडीगढ़ के तापमान में 4 डिग्री की गिरावट आई है, जिससे यह अब 37.7 डिग्री पर पहुंच गया है।

आज का मौसम-

भारत मौसम विज्ञान विभाग के अनुसार, रूपनगर, मोहाली, पटियाला, पठानकोट, होशियारपुर, नवांशहर, फतेहगढ़ साहिब, लुधियाना, बरनाला, संगरूर, मानसा और बठिंडा जिलों में कुछ स्थानों पर हल्की से मध्यम बारिश होने की संभावना है।

20 जून तक बारिश की संभावना

मौसम विभाग के अनुसार, अगले 24 घंटों तक राज्य में अधिकतम तापमान में कोई बड़ा बदलाव नहीं होगा। इसके बाद धीरे-धीरे 3-5 डिग्री सेल्सियस की गिरावट आने की संभावना है। 16, 17 और 18 तारीख को छिटपुट स्थानों पर हल्की से मध्यम बारिश होने की संभावना है, जबकि 19 और 20 तारीख को कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश हो सकती है।

title: Southwest monsoon to bring more rains; IMD Hyderabad forecasts thunderstorm - Siasat.com
article_text:
Representational Image

Hyderabad: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) Hyderabad has forecast thunderstorms until Thursday, June 19 as the southwest monsoon is expected to bring more rains to Telangana.

According to the weather department, various districts of Telangana are likely to witness thunderstorms, lightning, squalls, etc.

IMD forecasts rains in Hyderabad during southwest monsoon

For Hyderabad, the weather department forecast rains or thundershowers accompanied by gusty winds.

ALSO READ
Frankfurt Airport-Hyderabad Lufthansa flight makes mid-air U-turn

In the city, rains are expected only on Monday. However, hazy conditions will prevail from June 17 to 19.

ALSO READ
Hyderabad police book 7 for attacking AIMIM worker during MLA’s visit

Despite forecasts of rains and hazy conditions during southwest monsoon, the IMD has not issued any alert for Hyderabad until June 19.

Deficient downpours

As per Telangana Development Planning Society, in the current monsoon season so far, Telangana districts have received an average rainfall of 44.1 mm against the normal of 58 mm. This represents a deficit of 24 percent.

The highest rainfall deficit of 75 percent was recorded in Jayashankar district. The highest excess rainfall of 48 percent was recorded in Mahabubnagar district.

Meanwhile, in Hyderabad, the highest rainfall deficit of 81 percent was observed in Tirumalgiri.

Across Hyderabad, the average rainfall recorded was 25.9 mm against the normal of 55.3 mm, representing a deficit of 53 percent.

In view of the IMD Hyderabad’s forecast of rains until June 19, the deficit recorded so far is likely to decrease.
