title: Heavy Rain Alert: आज से अगले 6 दिन होगी मूसलाधार बारिश, इन राज्यों में जमकर बरसेंगे बादल - Patrika News
article_text:
इन राज्यों में होगी भारी बारिश ◙ मौसम विभाग के अनुसार 16 जून को तटीय आंध्र प्रदेश, यनम, तमिलनाडु, पुडुचेरी, तटीय कर्नाटक और कराईकल में कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 16-18 जून के दौरान कर्नाटक में भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 17 जून को तमिलनाडु, पुडुचेरी और कराईकल में कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 18 और 19 जून को केरल में भारी बारिश की संभावना है। इस दौरान इन राज्यों में 40-60 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की भी संभावना है।



◙ 16-21 जून के दौरान कोंकण, गोवा, मध्य महाराष्ट्र, सौराष्ट्र और गुजरात में कई जगह भारी बारिश की संभावना है।



◙ 16 से 21 जून के दौरान पश्चिम बंगाल, बिहार, झारखंड, ओडिशा और छत्तीसगढ़ में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर बिजली गिरने के साथ ही भारी बारिश की संभावना है।



◙ 19 और 20 जून को पूर्वी मध्य प्रदेश में भारी बारिश होने की संभावना है।



◙ 18-21 जून के दौरान उत्तरप्रदेश और उत्तराखंड में कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 20 और 21 जून को हिमाचल प्रदेश में कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 21 जून को हरियाणा में कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है।



◙ 16 जून को असम और मेघालय में अलग-अलग स्थानों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है। 16-21 जून के दौरान अरुणाचल प्रदेश में कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की संभावना है।

इन राज्यों में होगी हल्की/मध्यम बारिश ◙ मौसम विभाग के अनुसार 16-19 जून के दौरान तमिलनाडु, पुडुचेरी, तेलंगाना और कराईकल में कुछ जगह हल्की/मध्यम बारिश की संभावना है। इस दौरान आंधी, बिजली गिरने और 40-50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की भी संभावना है।



◙ 16-19 जून के दौरान मध्य प्रदेश, विदर्भ और छत्तीसगढ़ में कई स्थानों पर हल्की/मध्यम बारिश की संभावना है। इस दौरान आंधी, बिजली गिरने और 40-50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज हवाएं चलने की भी संभावना है।



◙ 16-21 जून के दौरान उत्तर-पश्चिम भारत में कुछ स्थानों पर हल्की/मध्यम बारिश के साथ-साथ आंधी, बिजली गिरने और 40-50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की भी संभावना है।



◙ अगले 6 दिनों के दौरान पूर्वोत्तर भारत में कई स्थानों पर हल्की/मध्यम बारिश, बिजली गिरने और 30-50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की संभावना है।



◙ अगले कुछ दिन राजधानी दिल्ली मे हल्की/मध्यम बारिश के साथ आंधी और बिजली गिरने की संभावना है। इस दौरान 40-50 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की भी संभावना है।



◙ अगले कुछ दिन जम्मू-कश्मीर में कई स्थानों पर हल्की/मध्यम बारिश की संभावना है।

title: Fairmont flooding: Building partially collapses amid West Virginia flash flood emergency| Video - Hindustan Times - Hindustan Times
article_text:
Subscribe Now! Get features like
Widespread flash flooding in West Virginia has caused part of a building to collapse on Locust Avenue in Fairmont, reportedly trapping several people. The collapse happened as the National Weather Service (NWS) issued a Flash Flood Emergency for Fairmont.
The NWS alert stated, “At 444 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.”
“This is a particularly dangerous situation. Seek higher ground now, ” the alert warned.
Fairmont, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Monongah, Rivesville, Grant Town, Farmington, Worthington, Bentons Ferry, Colfax, Baxter, White Hall, Idamay, Valley Falls, Everettville, and Carolina.
Emergency crews are conducting multiple water rescues near Fairmont. Evacuations are in progress in Pinchgut Hollow near Colfax.
Also Read: Fire in Draper, Utah: Blaze breaks out near South Mountain Golf Course| Video
At least four people have been killed and four others remain missing following severe flash flooding in West Virginia, according to BNO News. Among the confirmed victims is a 3-year-old child.
West Virginia Governor Patrick Morrisey has declared a state of emergency in Ohio County after flash flooding hit the city of Wheeling and nearby towns, including Triadelphia and Valley Grove, late Saturday evening.
"Please keep impacted communities in your prayers," Governor Morrisey said in a statement. "More storms are expected in the region today. Please follow all directives from local and state emergency management officials and do not attempt to drive through flooded roads.”

title: जम्मू-कश्मीर में हल्की बारिश ने दिलाई प्रचंड गर्मी से राहत, इस सप्ताह होती रहेगी प्री-मानसून की बौछार - Light rain in Jammu and Kashmir brought relief from the scorching heat pre monsoon showers will continue this week - Jagran
article_text:
HINDI NEWS
JAMMU-AND-KASHMIR
JAMMU
विज्ञापन हटाएं
सिर्फ ₹3 में
जम्मू-कश्मीर में हल्की बारिश ने दिलाई प्रचंड गर्मी से राहत, इस सप्ताह होती रहेगी प्री-मानसून की बौछार

जम्मू में भीषण गर्मी के बाद रविवार शाम को हुई बारिश ने लोगों को राहत दी। पश्चिमी विक्षोभ के चलते हुई इस बारिश से तापमान में गिरावट आई और मौसम सुहावना हो गया। मौसम विभाग के अनुसार आने वाले दिनों में प्री-मानसून की बारिश होने की संभावना है और इस साल मानसून भी जल्दी आ सकता है।

BY ASHOK SHARMA
EDITED BY: NITISH KUMAR KUSHWAHA
UPDATED: MON, 16 JUN 2025 07:55 AM (IST)
जम्मू-कश्मीर में बारिश के बाद सुहावना मौसम। फाइल फोटो
जागरण संवाददाता, जम्मू। पिछले सप्ताह की लगातार बेहाल करने वाली प्रचंड गर्मी से रविवार की शाम को हुई हल्की वर्षा के बाद कुछ राहत मिली। वर्षा के बाद हुआ मौसम लुत्फ लेने वाला था। लू के चलते बंद कमरों में अपने आप को कैद कर चुके लोगों ने खुली हवा का खूब मजा लिया।

बहुत से लोग वर्षा में नहाते दिखे और वर्षा देने के लिए इंद्र देव का आभार जताया। मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र श्रीनगर से मिली जानकारी अनुसार पश्चिमी विक्षोभ के दबाव के चलते आज की वर्षा हुई है। रविवार सुबह से ही हवा का दबाव बना हुआ था। दिन भर गर्म हवा के थपेडे़ बेहाल करते रहे।

रविवार की छुट्टी के बावजूद बाजारों में सन्नाटा ही दिखा। पूरे जम्मू कश्मीर में ही अधिकांश हिस्सों में मौसम सामान्य से गर्म रहा। दिन के तापमान में सामान्य से 1 से 4 डिग्री सेल्सियस तक की बढ़ोतरी दर्ज की गई।हालांकि जम्मू को छोड़ दूसरे सभी जिलों का अधिकतम तापमान 40 डिग्री सेल्सियस से कम रहा।जम्मू संभाग में तेज गर्मी का असर बना हुआ है जबकि कश्मीर घाटी में मौसम अपेक्षाकृत सुहावना रहा। कुछ क्षेत्रों में हल्की बारिश से तापमान में मामूली राहत मिली है।

विज्ञापन हटाएं
सिर्फ ₹3 में
शेर-ए-कश्मीर कृषि विश्वविद्यालय के मौसम विशेषज्ञ डॉ. महेंद्र सिंह अनुसार शुक्र- शनिवार को प्रीमानसून की वर्षा की संभावना है। वहीं कल भी मौसम आज की तरह ही बना रहेगा। प्रचंड गर्मी से हल्की राहत बनी रहेगी। आने वाले दिनों में कुछ इलाकों में बादल छाने और हल्की वर्षा की संभावना बनी हुई है।

यही वर्षा जब आगे भी जारी रहेगी तो इसे मानसून का आगाज भी कहा जा सकता है।मानसून जम्मू पहुंचने का सामान्य समय 27-28 जून रहता है लेकिन इस वर्ष मानसून जम्मू में जल्दी दस्तक दे सकता है।

title: Mumbai On Yellow Alert As IMD Warns Of High Tide And Continued Rain - MSN
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Mumbai, warning of continued rainfall and the possibility of high tidal waves.
Light showers have been lashing the city since last night, but there have been no reports of waterlogging so far. According to IMD, a high tide measuring 4.49 meters is expected in the Arabian Sea around 2:45 PM today. During this period, waves could rise as high as 14 feet, prompting authorities to remain on alert.
An IndiGo flight operating on the Bengaluru–Pune–Chennai route was significantly delayed on Thursday night after being diverted to Mumbai due to severe weather conditions in Pune.
Flight 6E 441/238 was scheduled to arrive at Pune Airport at 10:05 PM on June 12 and depart for Chennai at 10:45 PM. However, deteriorating visibility triggered by heavy rainfall and strong winds forced the aircraft to reroute mid-air and land in Mumbai instead. The plane eventually reached Pune at 1:32 AM on June 13—nearly three and a half hours behind schedule—and departed for Chennai at 3:07 AM.
Mumbai's vulnerability to intense rain events is growing, as evident from a recent downpour that drenched Nariman Point with 104mm of rain in just one hour on May 26. This deluge caused severe waterlogging in several areas of south Mumbai.
Beginning of dialog window. Escape will cancel and close the window.
Mumbai Metro: Mumbai Metro One Private Limited (MMOPL) has announced the withdrawal of the recently introduced shuttle service between Andheri and Ghatkopar. From June 16, all trains on Metro Line-1 will operate across the full Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar corridor. This change comes just three months after the shuttle service was introduced to manage peak-hour congestion.
The new plan includes a slight improvement in frequency, as the headway between two metro trains will be reduced from 205 seconds to 200 seconds, beginning Monday. MMOPL stated that this adjustment aims to ensure a faster and smoother commute for daily passengers.
ALSO READ: Mumbai Metro Line 1 Update: Trains To Operate From Ghatkopar To Versova With Higher Frequency From THIS Date; Know Details
The shuttle service, launched in March 2024, was introduced as a short-loop solution to handle overcrowding on the Andheri-Ghatkopar stretch. The idea was to increase capacity on high-demand stations during busy hours. The Hindustan Times report cited MMOPL sources as stating that, the shuttle did not yield the expected results in terms of punctuality and crowd management, leading to its withdrawal.
Passenger traffic data indicates that the stations at Versova, DN Nagar and Azad Nagar received relatively fewer commuters, averaging 61,000 daily, compared to the overall Metro-1 ridership of around 4.55 lakh. The shuttle was intended to boost capacity on the central section of the corridor without significantly impacting stations with lower footfall.
ALSO READ: Thane-Borivali Tunnel Project Realigned to Ease Traffic, Address Resident Concerns
The Hindustan Times report cited a regular metro commuter, Dhaval Shah from Andheri, as stating that, the system continues to experience crowding issues. He suggested that MMOPL now consider increasing the number of coaches on each train. “Instead of 4-car trains, running 6-car metro trains could be a more effective long-term solution,” he said.
Mumbai Metro-1 has been operational since June 2014 and currently runs 444 services on weekdays. Over the past 11 years, the line has served over 1,112 million passengers, providing a key transport link across the city.

title: Directorate Of Education Directs Delhi Schools To Observe June As Anti-Malaria Month, Implement Preventive Measures Ahead Of Monsoon - MSN
article_text:
New Delhi: The Directorate of Education (DoE) has directed all government and private schools in Delhi to actively observe June as anti-malaria month and implement preventive measures to control the spread of the disease ahead of the monsoon.
The advisory was issued in continuation of an earlier circular dated April 15 on prevention and control of vector-borne diseases such as dengue, chikungunya, and malaria, the new circular issued on Friday said.
"All districts director of education and heads of government, government-aided, and private unaided recognised schools have been requested to follow the activities mentioned for prevention and eradication of malaria," it read.
NEET UG 2025 Results Out: Mahesh Kumar From Rajasthan Tops With 99.9999547 Percentile; Check Toppers List Here
The Ministry of Health has set 2030 as the target year for malaria eradication in India. "The month of June is observed as anti-malaria-month every year prior to monsoon to increase community awareness, participation and maintain sustained efforts," the circular added.
To curb mosquito breeding and water stagnation, all departments, offices, and institutes have been advised to check their premises regularly.
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has amended two processes related to know your customer (KYC) norms for ease and convenience of banking customers. In a notification dated June 12, 2025, the RBI said that now banking correspondent (BC) are permitted to conduct updation or periodic updation of KYC. Similarly the RBI also said that banks have to give at least three advance intimations including at least one intimation by letter to customers for complying with the periodic KYC updation process.
Just to give you a context, banking correspondents are NGOs, self-help groups (SHGs), micro finance institutions (MFIs) and other civil society organisations (CSOs) who are contracted by the bank to act as its agent. Your local kirana shop owner can also empannel as a BC, if he has got the necessary permission from the bank.
According to the Union Bank of India website: “Business Correspondent is an extended arm of the Bank Branch who is providing Financial and Banking services to the customers in unbanked and underbanked areas.”
“The Reserve Bank has observed a large pendency in periodic updation of KYC including in the accounts opened for credit of Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)/ Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) under Government schemes to facilitate credit of DBTs and/ or scholarship amount (DBT/ EBT/ scholarship beneficiaries) and accounts opened under PMJDY,” said the RBI in the notification.
The RBI said: “The banks are advised to organize camps and launch intensive campaigns including special camps, focusing on periodic updation of KYC, especially in rural and semi urban branches and the branches having large pendency in periodic updation of KYC. The banks may also facilitate the process of activation of such accounts by taking an empathetic view as indicated in the circular DoS.CO.PPG.SEC.12/11.01.005/2024-25 dated December 2, 2024.”
Shikhar Aggarwal, Chairman, BLS E-Services, says: "By simplifying KYC processes while ensuring regulatory compliance, the new guidelines will enable faster customer onboarding, promote the adoption of formal financial services, and facilitate withdrawals under Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) schemes."

title: Early Morning Showers Drench Mumbai; IMD Issues Orange Alert For Heavy Rainfall Today - ABP Live English
article_text:
ABP NEWS LIVE 24*7: Sandeep Chaudhary LIVE | Pakistan | Donald Trump | Shahbaz sharif | PoK
Mumbai woke up to a wet start on Monday as intense early morning showers lashed the city, leaving roads submerged and daily life momentarily thrown off track. Between 2 am and 5 am, the rain came down hardest over South Mumbai and the western suburbs, prompting the India Meteorological Department (IMD) to issue an orange alert, warning of potential flooding and traffic disruptions throughout the day.
Several areas recorded substantial rainfall, with the Fort area topping the charts at 74 mm, followed closely by Bandra (62 mm), Malabar Hill (60 mm), and Lower Parel (58 mm). Other parts of the city weren't spared either — Haji Ali logged 57 mm, Matunga 56 mm, Grant Road and Santacruz 47 mm each, and Dadar 41 mm.
#WATCH | Morning rain showers drench Mumbai; IMD has sounded an alert for heavy rain in the city today

Visuals from BPT, Wadala East pic.twitter.com/1tNkSRiADI
The western suburbs also saw a steady spell. Andheri recorded 33 mm, while Mumbai Central and Borivali received 30 mm and 28 mm, respectively. Light to moderate rain was also reported in Worli (26 mm), BKC (25 mm), Versova (23 mm), and Dindoshi (22 mm).
Interestingly, while Mumbai was drenched, Thane remained mostly dry during the same time frame, though the IMD has forecast rainfall in the area later today.
The IMD’s seven-day forecast suggests that Monday will continue to be rainy, especially over South Mumbai and parts of the western suburbs. The orange alert remains in place, signalling a likelihood of localised flooding, waterlogging, and major traffic delays.
Tuesday is expected to bring similar weather conditions, with heavy rainfall and overcast skies likely to persist. By Wednesday, however, the intensity of the rain is predicted to ease, with only intermittent showers expected and no official weather warnings in place.
As water filled streets and slowed traffic during the morning commute, civic authorities sprang into action. Disaster response teams have been put on standby, ready to step in should the situation worsen. Residents are urged to remain cautious, especially those in low-lying or flood-prone areas.
